choices: Your stomach growls. Feels like you haven't had food in days.
It feels drafty. You're not wearing any clothes.
Thunderclouds loom overhead. It's going to rain and you need to find shellter.
Angry voices. Some citizens are coming your way ang they aren't sounding happy.
Something more unusual happens?
1.content:
You groan as the world slowly begins to come into focus. Bright light shines through the branches of the tree overhead. Birds songs sing nearby and while beautiful do more to accent the headache you're currently sporting. Raising a hand to shade your eyes against the light, you gasp and discover it's not a normal hand but covered in black fur to the middle of your forearm and each finger is tipped with small claws. Crossing your eyes some reveals a discovery of a red furred snout and black tipped nose. Somhow you know this is wrong and yet you can't seem to recall what is 'right'.

Sitting up causes your headache to throb a bit harder but you are determined to examine your body and make a valiant attempt to ignore it. Looking your form over you discover you're in the shape of a red fox, judging by your paws, fluffy tail and colorings, but one that apparently can walk upright judging by your hands and the shape of you legs. Again the thought crossed your mind that this isn't normal, but with the headache it's hard to recall anything except your name. Everything else is a blur of colors and noises with no real structure or coherence.

Taking a few deep breaths you try to get your bearings. Now that your eyes have adjusted and your head has stopped spinning, you can see you appear to be in the center of a large park of some kind as tall buildings stretch upwards all around the edges. Grassy rolling hills stretch around you sparsely dotted with decently large trees. More interesting though is the park and city seem to be populated by other creatures in much the same state as you, all of them animals and yet all walking upright. Here and there you spot creatures that look like they stepped out of a cartoon or childrens' picture book as wolves, rabbits, tigers, zebras, and many more species walk down the paths, play games, or just laze about in the sun. What's more, not one you can see looks at all thin, oddly enough. Every single one runs the gambit of slightly chubby, like they'd had a few too many big meals lately, to something seen more often in a sideshow at the circus or a world record book. The largest of which actually need special platforms to get around as they float on what look like hover pads along the trails

Taking another deep breath you try and relax and decide what to do. Clearly action needs to be taken of some kind, you can't just sit there all day, but as you're trying to figure out what to do another pressing problem comes to mind....
1.title: Where it all begins...

choices: You agree to go to his house
You decline and decide to keep looking
Someone interrupts the two of you
You find something to eat in the park
Something completely unsuspected happens
11.content:
Your stomach rumbles...You feel like you have not had food in days!

Slowly you pick your way through the park, on your way you meet a pig Anthro!

He was fairly fat even for pig standards, but he was also incredibly tall! You realized he must be part razorback because he is covered with prickly brown hair!

"Whoa there Little Fellow!" The Pig-Man says "You look like you haven't eaten in days!"

"I feel like it!" You say

"Well why don't you come over to my house!" He say "I've burgers, hot dogs, cakes, ice cream and soda!"
11.title: Looking for food

choices: see a large van in parking lot. (Not Good!)
a huge limo! (he actualy is trust worthy?)
something else completely
111.content:
You follow the pig man (now that you think about it more like boar man) down a path that leads towards one of the smaller exits of the park. Feeling a sense of danger you keep your wits about you, for all you know this guy could be a kidnapper or something.

         Finally getting towards the exit gate you ask his name to see if you remeber if it is the name of any criminals you know.
"Sir I haven't got your name yet." you ask.
"The name is Mark Densin, boy, you may recognise me from the T.V.," 'He`s been on tv? Which chanle the crime watch?!' "...But I often come around looking for people to spend time with and to get to know better, ya know?" Mark replys.
Still in a way not getting a definent answer you walk towards the parking lot and see...
111.title: suspisious? Naaaahh.

choices: He isn't locking you up in the back, he just has a van. You decide to go along.
Still uneasy about the situation, you take off and don't look back.
1111.content:
Mark walked toward the parking lot while you trailed behind. You see a single white van parked in the lot. "Oh man..." the thought instantly crosses your mind,"He must be a kidnapper! He's going to throw me in the back!" Your ears fold down as the sense of terror wipes over you.
You stand still as Mark continues toward the lot and look around for any way out of the situation. And judging by his heavy build, you could probably outrun him. You contemplate your situation. Either run away and starve in a foreign world, or go with a person who may genuinely want to help you- but he also may be a criminal.
"Hey! Are ya comin' or not? You get shotgun." Mark looked back while opening the driver door. You had enough distance to run for it, if that's what you wanted to do.
1111.title: see a large van in parking lot. (Not Good!)

choices: "But I'm still SUPER hungry! I need to eat!"
"Good idea... plus I got really fat..."
11111.content:
You hop up in front and strap yourself in, eager to get your hands on some delicious food. The ride to his house seems forever because of your empty stomach, but it's only about thirty minutes. You look out the window as you approach a very large house- fancy too.
"Well, here we are!" Mark says as he parks the van in the driveway next to a few other, more expensive looking cars. "I got food inside for ya, ya seem starved." He walks up to his doorstep, grabs his keys and unlocks the door. You follow and as you walk in, you instantly smell an aroma of foods fill your nose. Your ears perk up in excitement.
"You can go into the dining room and eat what you want, I have food to spare." Without hesitation, you scurry into the dining room only to see tables of different food ready for your consumption. You walk over to the table full of cheeseburgers and french fries and begin devouring it. Eating burgers by the stack and fries by the handful. About a half hour passes and you ate at least sixty burgers and buckets worth of fries. However, your hunger was not merely satisfied.
You wander to another table filled with different pizzas and begin digging in. You don't even savor the sheer deliciousness of it all either, you just shove as much into your mouth as you can. You clear the enormous table of food, and by your fifth table, you pass out.
---
Mark jerks your shoulder while yelling at you to wake up. Eventually, you do, but you feel very different. Your body has become thickly layered with jiggly fat. For a while, you just lied on the ground unable to get up because of your weight. Mark pulls you up by your hands and you notice how of your belly stuck out from underneath your shirt. And your pants felt very, very tight.
"Hey, are you okay? Ya were passed out on floor." Mark said rather urgently.
"Yeah, I just ate too much is all I guess." You felt fine, but a little tried.
"Okay, ya probably shouldn't eat that much again. And ya may not want to eat again right away."
11111.title: He isn't locking you up in the back, he jus...

choices: You tell Mira you need to find help.
You scavenge the town for food- you feel hungrier than ever!
11112.content:
You sprint away the second he opened the driver door, still uncertain of this man's credibility and trustworthiness. You wind past some trees and don't stop, eventually, you see more furs around, but you're still running away. After so long you turn your head back in search for the pig, but you didn't stop running. The next thing you know is you make impact with something large and fluffy while your has was turned. You ran into somefur, and a rather big fur too.
"Ah!" The fat fox lady squeaked. "What was that?" She tried to shove her stomach down to see what hit her. "Oh, did you just run onto me?" He giggled.
"Yeah... sorry. I didn't see you there, I was looking backwards." You said awkwardly.
"Oh, backwards?" She laughed. "Are you new to town? I never saw you here."
"Yeah. Oh! And do you know anyplace to find some food?" Hunger hit you again now that you weren't focused on running away.
"Oh yeah, I have some at my place, my house is right over there." She lifted a her fat arm and pointed over to a nearby house. "Wanna go?"
"Okay, sure." She was obviously more trustworthy than that pig.
"Here, hop on my back, I have a hover platform so you don't have to walk."
You jump up onto her back, your feet sunk onto her large folds of gelatinous flab. You put your paws into her shoulders and hold on as you begin hovering toward the house. It was relatively fast. At this point you wanted one too, they're cool! Once you got there you didn't get off, because her house had extremely wide doors that allowed the platform to go inside, she must never get off of it.
"There's food in the fridge. I don't care how much you eat by the way. This town is built on food, like seriously, our town will never run out."
Taking the advice you raid whatever you can out of the fridge and devour it. It was a large fridge too, so eating everything seemed impossible. Eventually, all the food is gone, except for a brown mushroom in the back in a container. Still hungry, you have no choice but to eat it.
After that you felt stuffed and full. You walk into the living room and thank her. "Hey, I still don't know your name."
"Oh, my name's Mira."
"Whoa..." your stomach felt very bubbly inside, and it began to make some odd noses, "my stomach feels really weird, I guess something didn't agree with me."
"You didn't eat that mushroom did you!?"
"Yeah, why?" Worry grew in your voice.
"Those aren't regular mushrooms! Didn't you read the label on the container or was in that said not to eat it!" She seemed really worried and so did you.
"Wh- what are they!"
"They cause the consumer to produce more fat in your body than use sugar! You're going to slowly be gaining weight for who knows how long!"
Already, you could feel your body grow softer, and your belly grow.
"It's going to make you feel more hungry too because your body isn't producing enough energy, so you'll have to eat..."
11112.title: Still uneasy about the situation, you take off ...

choices: I'll do it!
I'm going to pass.
Hm... do you have any other shows?
112.content:
Unsure of how much money you have on you, and more importantly how the pig would react if you didn't have enough to cover your order, you politely decline his offer. "Sorry, man, I'm broke right now. Appreciate it, though. Have a nice day." A bit deflated, the pig thanks you for your time and begins pushing his cart away, searching for other park denizens whom he could interest in a bite to eat.

You walk further along the park's inner trails. It's a strikingly gorgeous place and fairly sparse to boot. Maybe the bigger physiques of the locals keep them from venturing this far from a place to sit and rest? You think to yourself for a few moments as you walk, wondering exactly what is going on with your current situation.

Lost in thought, you end up veering off the path and into a sign on the grass right next to it.

"Auditions ahead at the gazebo," the sign itself reads, although auditions for what, you're not sure. A small posting below it says that said auditions were running from 10 to noon, and looking at the sun, which is exactly centered in the sky, it looks like it's about closing time for them. Still wondering what could possibly be going on, you walk ahead to see what's up.

When you get to the gazebo, a white enclosure that's about 10' by 10' with a few tables and such surrounding it, you see that the auditions themselves appear to have been less than successful. A few assorted sheets of paper are strewn about the grass, while a few staffers take down a few tables. Among them is one elephant in a suit.

While the other staffers are fairly normal, maybe about 50 pounds overweight at most, this elephant has extravagantly let himself go. He's wearing some dapper duds, one step below a suit, and they strain to hold his belly, which seems to be about three feet wide. The rest of him is suitably swollen as well - you'd bookmark him at about 600 pounds. Still wondering what the story was here, you figure that he'll have answers and walk over to him.

Initially, as you walked up to the gazebo, the elephant had a somewhat-concerned look upon his face, but everything seems to change when you walk into his field of view. His relatively dour demeanor completely changes, his eyes becoming more expressive and his mouth breaking out into a grin under his trunk.

"Hello sir! How are you today?!", he bellows, thrusting out a hand for you to shake. "Are you here for the auditions?"

"Well... I guess I am," you say. "I was walking along and wondering what was going on here..."

"Excellent! My first question for you, of course - do you want to be a reality TV star?"

Wow, that was straightforward. You've always wanted to be famous, of course. Who hasn't? But there's no sense in signing up for something you have no clue about in the first place, either.

"Well, of course I would, but I have no idea what I'd be getting myself into," you stammer out.

"Son, you're in the right place. We've been looking for candidates for a new reality competition, and we're one short." Glancing you over, he continues, "Your... let's say lithe physique is perfect for what we're trying to do."

"And what exactly is that?" Once again, you think, better safe than sorry.

"My television station, YummTV, is branching out into a new niche we've found is likely to provide us with a hit in Zaftig City. The new show is called 'The Biggest Gainer,' and it takes several undernourished people like yourself and gets them more well-rounded for city life here. Our winner not only takes home $250,000 on top of their makeover, but they'll also receive their own half-hour TV show on our network in whatever kind of genre they'd be interested in. It's an easy sell, right?"

"So this is a game show where thin people, like myself, get fat for money."

"In short, yes. We've found there's big demand among those who have taken to life in Zaftig to see others follow in their footsteps."

On the one hand, this sounds ridiculous, even before you consider that it could be too good to be true, or even a complete lie. $250,000 is crazy! It's also... it's a lot of money. And you've always wanted to be a bigger-than-life TV star. You'll never have to worry about another diet again... what's your decision?
112.title: You decline and decide to keep looking

choices: Cassie takes you to the station headquarters
The studio's located right by the park in a flat, wide building
Wait, why are you stopping at a supermarket?
1121.content:
$250,000 is more money than you've made in your lifetime. You've always wanted to be on TV. When you were in college, you loved the few times you took advantage of the all-you-can-eat cafeteria... and now, you won't have to run on a treadmill for hours on end to take care of the side effects. Let's face it, you're a glutton for attention.

Flashing your best thousand-dollar smile, you give the elephant a wolfish grin. "You know what, sir? I'm in."

The elephant's face is euphoric. "You have no idea how great that news is, Mr..."

Wait. Do you have a name? You can't remember your name, and you have no ID. Crap. Thinking quickly, you make up the first, worst thing you can consider.

"Sunday. Cherry Sunday's the name," you tell him... hoping he doesn't see the ice cream shop's advertisement flying behind his head.

"That's an odd name," the elephant starts to say. "And yet you're as thin as a twig?"

"Yeah," you quickly stammer, "my parents named me Jerry originally, but I got the nickname after the ice cream because of my coloring," you lie through your teeth. To be fair, it's not a terrible lie, as your red fur is dark enough, and your white fur creamy-colored enough, to help you out.

The elephant considers this for a moment. "Well, with such a name, I'll be expecting big things from you! By the way, the name's Cal Pachy."

"Cassie, come here," Cal says to one of the workers, who is finished removing the postings from the audition. "Could you take Mr. Sunday here to the studio? Now that we've got him in the picture, we can get things started tonight."

A tabby cat walks over to you, wearing a YummTV branded shirt over her corpulent frame. "Right this way, Mr. Sunday," she says, gesturing toward a large golf cart near the far side of the gazebo. As you climb in, sitting in the seat that could hold a fur four times your side, you suddenly get a small bout of butterflies. "My big TV debut..." you think to yourself. "No wait, my BIG TV debut," you correct yourself, chuckling a bit. Whatever the next few days will hold, you'll likely come out a changed person...
1121.title: I'll do it!

choices: Time to meet the competitors
You're taken straight to the first event
11212.content:
In only a few minutes, you find yourself awoken from daydreams about gorging yourself on desserts as the golf cart slows in front of a long, wide building that's only a story tall. "Are... are we here?", you ask after a moment.

"Yep! Mr. Pachy had an old manufacturing building re-fitted for the pilot season of TBG," the cat responds to you as she disembarks from the cart, beckoning you to follow her. As the two of you walk through the front door, you find yourself gaping at what you see. What used to be a manufacturing floor, filled with machinery and equipment, has been replaced by not only a large living arrangement in one quarter of its space, but a strange assortment of sets and laboratories. One appears to be a supermarket, albeit half-sized, though apparently operational and stocked with a variety of different products. Also on the floor include a few separate obstacle courses, what appear to be game show sets, and a series of vats near the center of the floor. Whatever's going to take place here will be interesting.

After giving you some time to gawk, you find yourself whisked into the living area, where you're seated in a bedroom. "This will be your living space," Cassie says, as a few workers - a wolf and a gator, both obese - bring in a series of forms and assessments that you need to fill out. One's a series of information and nicknames, for example, meant for improving the narrative process of the show. Others have medical information, clothing preferences, allergies, and legal information. You're even measured in both size and weight.

After this, you find yourself outfitted in a jumpsuit that's both snug and tight. Examining yourself in the mirror, you see that it sags in places in which weight would add itself to a body, such as in the belly, waist, arms and legs. It's red and white, matching your natural fur colors. As soon as you seem comfortable, a camera crew comes in along with an interviewer, who gathers some additional information from you on camera - your name, your favorite foods, basic stuff meant to flesh out your character. Near the end, you're asked for a motto you'd like to apply to what YummTV will be calling "Team Sunday" - not great at thinking on your feet, you clumsily respond "Gotta stay hungry."
11212.title: The studio's located right by the park in a...

choices: Rush over for the first event
Rush over for an official opening ceremony
112121.content:
The next logical step, according to the film crew, is for you to meet the other contestants. You're escorted into the living room of the living area, where you're brought face to face with your competition for the money.

On the left is a male falcon, who stands a bit shorter than the rest of the team. He's fairly lean, and his brown and black jumpsuit is flattering to his figure. Next to him is a female hippo - while hippos usually come large, she's smaller than expected, only slightly overweight in a gray jumpsuit, her cute belly poking out. Further down the line, you find a male tiger, who has a tiny gut that hangs just over his belt in his orange and black jumpsuit. Bringing up the rear are a cute husky girl wearing a blue and white suit and a badger girl wearing glasses in a black and white ensemble.

Over the next ten minutes, the producers tell you about each other. The falcon's name turns out to be Apollo. The hippo's name is Sally, the tiger is Rip, the husky is Frost and the badger's name is Tina. No one really bats an eye during your introduction, taking your name at face value.

After the introductions are over, you exchange pleasantries with your fellow competitors, but you're suddenly halted as the voice of Cal booms over a speaker. "Contestants report to the supermarket now!"
112121.title: Time to meet the competitors

choices: As much as possible - take no risks
Play cautiously - you don't want to get carried away
1121211.content:
You and your fellow competitors make your way over to the supermarket area in the factory, but on your way you stop for a moment. In the center of the arena, over the vats, a scoreboard has been constructed, on which your six names are displayed, along with a count of each contestant's respective weight. Apollo weighs 140 pounds, while you're hanging in there at around 160. In rising order from there are Rip and Frost at 175, Tina at 180 and Sally at the top with about 220 pounds. After examining the board, you quickly continue on to the supermarket.

"Welcome to The Biggest Gainer!", booms Cal when you get to its entrance. "You're all probably wondering what's going on right now. I figured it was time for the first event, not to lose any time! I want this show on the air in a matter of hours! Now, here's the deal for your first task. Each of you will have five minutes in this supermarket, and your aim is to grab as much of your favorite food as possible. After the ten minutes, you'll have the next twelve hours back in the living area to eat as much as you can. Just, you know, totally pig out and stuff. As soon as that's done, we'll have your first weigh-in. Whoever comes in last for pounds gained walks out the door, and whoever comes in first gets our first award. I'll explain those later. As for the order... you're going in in order of how much you weigh. That means Apollo's up first."

Cal waves his arm, and as Apollo walks toward the entrance, the windows of the supermarket are blackened. "Can't have anyone copying strategy!"

As a whistle sounds, Apollo runs into the supermarket, pushing a cart in front of him. "Cherry, you're up next."

You'll have five minutes in the supermarket. What's your focus going to be?
1121211.title: Rush over for the first event

choices: Take ten minutes to survey your surroundings
Get eating
11212111.content:
As you're brought to the front of the supermarket, you quickly assess your strategy. You're one of the smaller furs entered in the reality show, and you're going to have to do more than just eat normally to stay in the competition. As a result, you're firmly set in your strategy - get as much food that's as easy to get down as possible.

Suddenly, you hear a bang, and you realize your five minutes have started. Quickly, you run into the market and look at the aisles. The dairy is to the left, and that's where you go. If you're going to take this seriously, milkshakes are going to be a lot easier to drink nonstop than regular food. Cart in hand, you rip open a freezer door and fling carton after carton of various ice creams into it. Filling it as full as possible, you quickly grab a second cart and check the milk and cream sections. You're in luck - not only do they have heavy cream, but they have plenty of eggnog, too. These, too, quickly enter your cart. Filling it all the way, you immediately rush to get another cart and repeat the process, then another. You're about halfway done filling a third cart with heavy-churn chocolate when you hear a 'ding.' Immediately, two workers come from the back of the store and grab your carts, telling you to follow them. They gradually bring you and your small dairy farm's worth of groceries back to your bedroom, where a massive fridge has been installed, along with a small kitchennete, complete with a blender.

You're looking at your new stuff when Cal himself pops into the doorframe. "Hey, Cherry, nice strategy," he tells you. "Thanks," you reply.

"You're probably wondering why we gave you these jumpsuits," Cal says, and your confused face prompts him to go further. "These suits can help you eat more food longer and get fatter easier," he continues, "only needing you to pat your belly."

You have no idea what he's talking about, so you pat your belly. Suddenly, the jumpsuit seems to stick to your frame a bit more, and it feels strange. Inside the suit, you feel like you're buzzing slightly, and your stomach becomes much more sensitive. By the time you recover enough to say something to Cal, he's already gone, and the two workers have completely filled your fridge, leaving the door wide open. A clock in the room has also been installed - it says "12:00", then "11:59." You realize it's your timer.
11212111.title: As much as possible - take no risks

choices: You come in first place
You come in third place
112121112.content:
Your belly's rumbling begins to intensify, and you start to feel a bit famished. As the clock turns to 11:58, you decide to waste no more time.

First, a full tub of ice cream gets thrown into the blender, followed by cartons of heavy cream and eggnog. After a quick swirl, your first of many milkshakes is finished, and with a hearty "Gotta stay hungry," you swiftly begin drinking the gallon of fattening dairy. Two minutes of beleagured chugging later, you've finally killed the drink, and look down at your belly. It's somewhat swollen, popping out about a half-inch from your waist. Almost before your eyes, however, that small bump slightly shrinks, and the rest of your body slightly shudders. That must be the jumpsuit taking effect, you think. Grabbing a second tub of ice cream, you grab a serving spoon out from a drawer and dig into it, gulping down spoonfuls as big as half a scoop at a time. For some reason, the suit prevents you from getting full - as you down your third, then fourth tubs over a half-hour span, your belly starts keeping its slight heft, growing a bit more noticeable with every few bites.

After you've managed to kill six tubs of ice cream, you finally come up for air, finding that you've been eating for an hour straight. Pausing for a moment, you look down at yourself. Your gut is now slightly prominent, and while the growth isn't too dramatic, you've definitely added about ten pounds onto your frame.

With a smug look on your face, you turn back to the fridge. Wanting to go full hog, you get your hands on a dozen cartons of eggnog and arrange them on the table. Opening all twelve, you get yourself in eyeline of the clock and decide to create an eggnog challenge.

As the clock hits 10:55 remaining, you grab the first carton and suck down what's inside in a matter of seconds, killing the carton in half a minute. You manage to get five down in two minutes and change, at which point you begin taking the cartons two-at-a-time. After another three minutes, you groggily finish the last of the twelve. If your gut wasn't noticeable before, now it is. It's clearly a few inches off your frame, and it's finally telling you it's near bursting. Guess the jumpsuit can only do so much. Resisting the allure of resting, you pull open the fridge again and lean yourself against the door.

For the next few hours, you pass out in a delicious food coma for two-hour spans, at which point you wake up to find a smaller, yet more permanent gut. When you wake up, dull hunger brings you straight to the freezer for another half-gallon tub of ice cream washed down with half a gallon of heavy creamer, after which you become too full to do anything but sleep more.

Finally, with an hour left, you find yourself coming to again. Examining the damage, you can see your gut has definitely grown. Somewhere close to five inches off your waistline, it's held up somewhat by the jumpsuit. Looking to pull yourself up, your arm brushes your thigh, making you reassess things. Your legs are each a bit thicker, while your arms are as well. It almost looks like you've been working out, yet the puffiness is from fat instead.

One hour left. It's time to ensure your safety, you think. Grabbing as many drinks as you can reach, you begin pouring them in your mouth, covering yourself in the process. At the same time, you pull a bunch of ice creams out of the freezer and gradually let them melt. By the end of the hour, between pouring eggnog and cream into your stomach and drinking down melted tubs of ice cream, you see your belly has expanded another inch and a half, while your arms and legs are even thicker, slightly bulging against the jumpsuit. Your butt, especially, has seen growth, becoming a true booty and expanding out by three or four inches. As the bell sounds, you're told to use a scale that's been placed outside the door. Your red-furred behind has grown by 60 pounds.
112121112.title: Get eating

choices: dozens of piles of food
four chairs in a circle
1121211121.content:
Almost immediately, another one of Cal's assistants gets you from the room and whisks you to another part of the building. You and the rest of the competitors are guided onto a stage, and though the scene is rushed and confusing, you're able to check out each one's changes after the first round ended. Apollo, the fit falcon, doesn't appear to have been able to do anything to himself - he only has the slightest pooch of a belly. Both Frost and Tina were able to do somewhat better - they look like their jumpsuits fit just a bit more snugly, their slightly-prominent bellies jutting out an inch or two more. Sally, the hippo, is clearly at least 30 pounds bigger than she was before - her everything creeps just a bit further out than it used to, especially her gut, which is much more noticeable than before. Your biggest surprise is the tiger - his gut extends more than a few inches over his belt, now, and the rest of his body follows suit. However, you're confident that you've done the most, and your suspicions are confirmed when Cal reads off the results.

"In last place, we have Apollo, the falcon, who was only able to gain 10 pounds. Apollo, I'm sorry, but your time on The Biggest Gainer has ended," Cal says, as two assistants appear to whisk him off-stage and away from the competition. "From there, we have Frost, who gained 15 pounds, and Tina, who added 18. Sally is in third place with 30 pounds added, while Rip takes second with almost 40 new pounds of fat. However, our first-place prize goes to Cherry, who put on an absolutely stellar 60 pounds in the first round!"

Cal walks over and presents you with a candy bar. You give him a look that suggests "That's it?", but he smiles and continues talking. "For his success, Cherry has earned a skip pass! Should you fall behind in a future competition, you'll be able to eat that candy bar and instantly add 40 pounds to your frame," he said. "After all, while we measure overall gains, you've gotta place in every round to move on. Speaking of which... it's time for our second competition!", he says into the camera. A curtain lifts about 50 feet away from the five of you remaining, across the stage, where you see...
1121211121.title: You come in first place

choices: You win again
You didn't win, but are in second place  with Rip taking 1st place
11212111211.content:
A curtain lifts about 50 feet away from the five of you remaining, across the stage, where you see dozens of piles of food. Your stomach gurgles at the sight. You see Cal walk towards the stage. He eyes you and the other competitors. He then grabs a microphone and prepares to announce the challenge.

"For this challenge you will eat these piles of food. However certain piles contain an appetite stimulant. consuming the stimulant will give you an edge in this round. Your belly has grown out of your chest, growing wider and rounder as time goes on, and your arms and legs are significantly more swollen. "That's right, folks, it's time for our competitors to put their new bodies to the test! Each one will be given unlimited milkshakes. They'll need to keep drinking, and try to do so as fast as possible - when they all tap out, the one who drinks the least is going home!"

As quickly as possible, more assistants guide you to a massive chair, where there's a table full of milkshakes in front of you. It looks like every one is a different flavor - you can see chocolate, strawberry, banana, vanilla, mint, cookies and cream... your mouth waters as you survey the offerings in front of you.

11212111212211121212111.content:
You wake up to the sound of your hotel room phone, you look around at your room, your king-sized bed is covered with empty ice cream containers and cartons of cream and other dairy products. You don't know what day it is, you've been stuffing yourself and falling into a food coma repetitively for at least a couple of days now, that's all you know. Looking up and seeing the time and date on your bedside clock, you work out it's been three days. You look down at your larger gut which blocks the view of your tree-trunk thighs, giving it a pat and a squeeze, assessing the extra padding that's been added.

You feel like ordering room service again, but realize that the phone has now been ringing for a couple of minutes. You struggle to sit upright, your heavy fat making it hard to move, your belly stops you from being able to sit straight up from a laying position, so you have to steady yourself with your paws on the bed. The few minutes you spend panting just trying to pull yourself up makes the phone ring off and the answer machine starts playing.

"Cherry, it's Cal. We're starting the first shoot on your hosting debut today." He says excitedly. "I don't know if you got any of the ratings we sent through, but The Biggest Gainer was a hit. We're going to shoot another soon, but in the meantime, the people love you! I get the feeling that if this new project goes well, you'll be the new face of YummTV in Zaftig city! Just get down to the studio asap."

You blink and try to take it all in... get to the studio asap? You can barely get out of bed. You manage the heave your body out after some minutes of struggling and head for the bathroom, struggling to get into the shower, even though it's wider than the average. As you run the hot water and wash yourself off, you feel your butt pressing against the glass behind you and giving a low squeak, your cheeks acting like a window cleaner's sponge. You think to yourself that you'll soon need to get upgraded to one of the superfat suites. You dry off and pull on your jumpsuit again because it's all you have. You decide what to do next.

You waddle down to the lobby and see a chunky panda with a suit and cap on and a badge that has the "YummTV" logo on it there waiting for you.

"Mr Sunday?" He asks as you approach.

You nod and he takes you to your ride. On the way a few furs in the lobby turn and look, they point you out and stare. A couple take out camera phones and snap pictures of you. Cal wasn't lying, you're becoming a celebrity. You're glad to get out of view of the fans, a stretch limo which looks wider than any car you've seen before is waiting outside. You climb inside through the extra-wide door, luckily it's roomy enough for your thick body to fit. The limo is very nicely furnished, wide, comfortable seats which you rest back into. It also a mini-fridge and drinks dispenser, and a flat-screen TV behind the driver's seat which is already turned on and tuned into the YummTV network. It looks like some kind of entertainment report is on.

"...fan-favorite from The Biggest Gainer, Cherry Sunday, is set to film a pilot for his very own gain-show. The show will feature celebrities battling it out against each other, and against Cherry himself, in weight-gain themed challenges." The screen pulls up footage of you from The Biggest Gainer, drinking pints of milkshakes by the second, you can't help but feel a bit longing when you see how fat you were then... at least 500lbs.

Your stomach gives a gurgle and the TV gives you an idea, you reach over to the drinks dispenser and push the milkshake button, a cup drops down that is at least a half-gallon in size and the nozzle quickly fills it with strawberry milkshake. You lift it to your lips and drink it down with ease, the smooth, creamy drink washing over your tongue and gulping down your throat with ease, your belly distending a little from the drink but not that noticeably.

It's only a short drive to the Studio, and you arrive there quickly. You recognize Cassie, the large tabby cat from when you first met Cal, approaching as you shift your milkshake filled gut and climb out of the limo. She is holding a clipboard and seems rushed, giving you your instructions.
112121112122111212121111.title: Go Straight to the Studio

choices: The show's ratings are stellar, making you an instant star
Holly wants to hang out after the show
1121211121221112121211112.content:
"We're filming in ten minutes. You need to get to the set now," Cassie says, barely looking up at you from her production notes. You stand there, just a bit surprised you're going directly on stage. After about 10 seconds, the tabby cat looks up at you with a frown. "Go to the set."

"I don't know where it is, this is my first time here!", you respond.

Her mood lightens. Not completely - she looks at her schedule and then at her watch, muttering to herself - but she looks back up at you. "Sorry, forgot you were a newbie," she says. "Follow me."

She walks you into the studio and directly to Stage 3A, where a large stage awaits you, complete with a studio audience. You're whisked backstage as you try to take stock of what's on stage - looks like a few podiums on the right and about fifteen feet by fifteen feet of space on the left, where stagehands are furiously working to slap the pieces of what looks like an obstacle course together - before you find yourself in a green room.

Inside are two other furs, a 300-or-so pound jackal and a 400-pound lynx. They're both wearing the same jumpsuits you are, though theirs are blue/black and green/white compared to your red one. The jackal's name is Terry, he's a stand-up comedian, he tells you. "This'll be great," he says. "Fat jokes kill with this crowd." The lynx, Holly, is a pop singer. "I'm trying to get bigger so I can stand out more," she says. "I'm only the ninth-fattest singer on the charts, and the record companies give the bigger ones the better songs."

After you get to know each other for a minute, Cassy explains the rules. "OK, you'll be flying blind a little, Cherry, but you'll do fine," she says.

Since all of you are wearing the same suits, the studio has made weight gain easy, Cassie explains. The first round will be trivia at the podiums, multiple choice questions with five possible answers. Terry and Holly will have 30 seconds to answer 10 total questions in this round. Getting a question right adds 10 pounds, while answering wrong means no gain. They each have one token, though - when they cash them in, the player makes you answer the question. If you get it right, you gain five pounds; wrong, ten pounds. It then gets Whoever gets more right at the end takes the lead.

In the second round, the players each run an obstacle course in the built side of the stage. Whoever finishes it faster gains forty pounds. Pretty simple, and you just watch.

The final round is an eating challenge, where the two players face off until one of them loses. The victor, who gains more wins $50,000 for their charity of choice, then challenges you as a bonus round. If they can outeat you in three minutes, they win an extra $10,000 for themselves.

So, in other words, you're going to be gaining some weight every episode. Which, when you look back on your last time on TV, doesn't sound so bad.

For your first day on the job, TV hosting comes pretty naturally to you. You come up with some zingers that actually make the audience laugh, and both guests make fast friends with you. Of course, they both use their coins on you early - you get one of the two questions right, adding 15 pounds. Terry takes an early lead with 40 pounds gained, his shirt tighter, but Holly comes back in the second round, going from 430 to 470 when she easily beats Terry in the obstacle course. The final challenge, endless pizza, lasts nearly twenty minutes before Holly lays back after taking a one-pizza lead at the nine-pies mark and Terry gives up with a groan.

Holly and Terry's suits both automatically digest their huge meals - Holly's weight leaps to 500 - "now the sixth-biggest singer," says a cue card you're handed and repeat on-air - and Terry goes from 340 to 370 pounds, both of them visibly larger than when they came in.

The final round is right up your alley, it turns out - milkshakes. You're both seated in front of a dozen large milkshakes of all flavors, and you lick your lips, ready to add to the half-gallon currently settling down into your stomach. You both start chugging, but you can tell you've got a big jump on her. After three minutes, you're finishing your eighth, your belly quickly swelling, as she struggles with her sixth, suffering from brain freeze. Leaning back and patting your belly, you tease Holly, before the milkshakes too suddenly digest, showing themselves with instant weight gain. You're 30 pounds bigger just from today, just up over 400 pounds, while the lynx girl ends up at 515 pounds. "Congratulations Holly, and we'll join you next week!", you say, and just like that, your television debut is over, and the audience is on its feet, giving you a standing ovation.
1121211121221112121211112.title: You need to get to set

choices: Gain a lot and try for The List

11212111212211121212111121.content:
After the show ends, you're free to head back to the hotel. Back into the limo, past the fans, back to the hotel, up to your room, straight to sleep. The jitters, then the adrenaline from succeeding, and all the milkshakes have exhausted you quickly, and you end up sleeping for twelve hours into the next morning.

You turn on the news and, lo and behold, they're talking about YOU. Specifically, they're doing an entertainment spotlight and the focus is... you. The obese cheetah and scarlet macaw on screen are gushing all about you, your performance, and most interestingly your weight.

"We have confirmation from the network that 'Bet Your Belt,' the new reality show from last night starring recent champion Cherry Sunday, broke several records last night," the cheetah says. "Pulling in a 12.5 rating, it was easily the highest performer of the night and looks like it'll get to ride that for a while, likely thanks to its host."

"Cherry is completely unknown, which makes this a shock," the macaw says, "but his recent win in 'Biggest Gainer,' as the show has been named, drew plenty of attention. Combine that with his natural charisma and he's turning a lot of heads."

They show video of you eating fast during the bonus round, then a montage of your past weight gaining challenges. "Sunday also looks like he's quite happy with his weight, and wants more of it," the cheetah says. "He's just over 400 pounds now, which doesn't even crack the top 50 in Zaftig City, but judging by last night, he might be on his way up the ladder."

The two are ending their segment. "Of course, the top 10 have a huge lead on him," the cheetah laughs. "That's true, Phil," the macaw replies. "Who knows, maybe he'll decide to climb?"

You change the channel on the TV, first surprised you're a sudden celebrity and second confused about this "top 50" and "top 10" they mentioned. Little did you know you'd stumble on another TV show, this one called "Watching The Top."

A giant, nearly-700-pound husky greets you. "Welcome to the show, I'm Champ Trant," he says, "former football star turned acting star, and number 47 on The List. That, for any newbies, is Zaftig City's list of its 50 fattest superstars, all of whom receive a stipend from the city government in support of the famous 1965 Weight Mandate."

You watch the rest of the program in confusion and awe. Champ is massively fat, but he's only 47th-biggest. As the show goes on, the furs get bigger (and a lot richer) - there's number 25, Miss Zaftig City '11, a lioness standing at 913 pounds, and number 11, a comedian who's at 1,093 pounds. The top 10 get even bigger - you turn off the TV but the number amount for the biggest apparently nearly reaches a ton.

You see two roads here.

1122.content:
You tell the elephant that you're going to pass on the idea. Disappointed, he shoos you away, and you keep walking. A few blocks later, you're in front of a restaurant, Big Ending, with a Help Wanted sign on the door. Walking in, it appears to specialize in desserts, and large ones at that - all around, there are furs sitting in front of huge pies, massive ice cream sundaes, giant cakes. Serving them are various furs, all of them looking stuffed in their black restaurant shirts.

Greeting you at the hostess's table is a young female fox, about 300 pounds and in a tight server uniform. You ask about the Help Wanted sign, and she calls her manager, a wolf who's easily 500 pounds.

It turns out that the restaurant's hook for the meals being so big is that they're specially meant for fattening people, fitting for Zaftig City, and whatever the patrons don't eat, the servers need to finish. Which explains why the workers seem like they're getting slightly bigger with taut stomachs. Thing is, the rate is good - $20 an hour, as many hours as you can last - and you can start immediately, he says.

Not having many other options, you agree, and he puts you in a uniform - an extra-large shift and baggy sweatpants, both black with the restaurant's logo on the front and back of the shirt and on the pant leg. To start, he only gives you one table, and you first serve a crocodile well over 400 pounds, his belly almost pressing into the table. He grins when he sees you and orders two large desserts, and while he eats slowly, by the time you hand him his check he's only finished half of each.

Turns out the weight gain aspect is a special feature of the restaurant, and your new boss guides you to a special seating section where you and your fellow servers clear the excess food in front of some of the patrons. Being hungry, you start eating the chocolate sundae, with about a football's worth of ice cream left, and you're feeling a bit full by the time you finish it. At which point you're handed the half-piece of vanilla cake, nearly a foot tall. It takes you over an hour to get the last bites down, and after a few minutes of rest, the wolf sends you back out on the floor, your belly a bit swollen.

Your next table is a group of three college girls, each one at least 300 pounds, all in their sorority gear. The hyena laughs when she sees you, and nudges the tiger and the jackal. They order a total of five desserts and leave almost three of them by the time they leave, only they walk down to the viewing area (adding a big tip and one of their numbers to their bill as they go). They leave after a while - and somehow, almost two hours later, you choke down the last of the peanut butter pie, your belly fully distended. As well, you can feel a big pudgier in your extremeties.

The boss, knowing you're broke, hands you your pay for the night as you slowly waddle home, looking to gain more than 10 pounds in a single night. The $120 in your hand is better than you expected, and while the wolf welcomes you back tomorrow, you're uneasy about an extended career with this business.

11221.content:
Exhausted from the hours of eating, you decide to take the easy route for now and find a cheap hotel room for $50 a night. You don't do much when you get in the room, other than unceremoniously passing out on the bed, rubbing your packed stomach.

The next morning, you're suspiciously hungry and your belly's completely empty, though it's gained a bit of girth that wasn't there before. The rest of your body is the same - you just feel slightly puffier here and there, guessing you've gained a little more than 10 pounds. You made good money, though, and it's an easy gig for now. You might even be able to land better tips today, now that you know how to serve and respond to your customers. As a result, you decide to take a risk and head back in for another day of work.

Things go easier today since you're there early enough for the tail end of breakfast. You meet your coworkers while you wait for your first table - they're all young and working there as their first job in Zaftig City, using it to gain weight for free to make the rest of their stays easier.

About an hour passes before your first table, and it's a mother and young son, both lions, who are only about 50 pounds over weight. They only order one ice cream sundae and finish the vast majority of it together, meaning you only need to take a few bites to finish things. Of course, that allows you to be free just in time for a group of two hippos and an elephant, all of them meeting their species' average size requirements. And appetites, too. You shudder as they each order four desserts, needing four trips to bring the dozen massive plates. Luckily, they each finish three plates; unluckily, that leaves three more for you to down. The cake is easy, but the pudding sticks to your ribs, and the ice cream makes you feel very bloated, about as full as you were yesterday.

The wolf comes over to you, more than willing to let you off for the day so you don't make yourself sick. Unfortunately, you've only made $60 on the day. If you stick around after a short break, you could make a good amount more - but you run the risk of getting another table of leftovers, which wouldn't just make you choke down more fattening meals but leave you nearly catatonic for who knows how long.

He also offers you a pill - it's for workers who want more hours. It's fast-acting and digests the food in your stomach in minutes, but it doubles the weight you gain from the meal itself. Right now, you'd probably gain close to 20 pounds from your last meal. Will you take the pill?

1122111.content:
You decide to take the pill. Resigned to some weight gain anyway, you figure it'll be easier in the long run to get it over with now, and hope your next tables are easy, or at least you'll make some decent money.

The pill immediately starts to take effect, and your swollen belly starts to shrink, the evident pounds spreading to your arms and legs. You can see your stomach start to make a slight indent in the XL shirt, but the plus size is that you're willing and able to take your next table.

Your decision to take this table ends up paying off in one way, but is a terrible decision in another. Your next customers are two female tabby cats who are absolutely massive, each at least 600 pounds, and they take a quick liking to you. They ask you to chat for a few minutes before ordering, asking you how you like working at the restaurant so far. When you get to the pill, their eyes go wide, and they look at each other with a smirk. "Your boss didn't tell you about that pill's effects, did it?", one asks. "Well, not really," you say. "Well, we'll get one of... well, let's get six desserts each," she says. Her sister chimes in - "actually, I'll take seven," she says. You dutifully take their orders and deliver the smorgasbord of desserts to them quickly. Each takes one bite of each dessert, then say in unison, "I'm full."

Leaving you with 13 desserts to eat yourself. There's no way you're going to be able to do this, is there? You ask your boss, who laughs. Some customers like to do this to employees, he says. And then he says you've gotta get started. He'll give you a $40 bonus for every dessert you eat. You clear the table and bring all of the desserts to the employee eating area, and the cats quickly follow. You start eating... and find your stomach passes the food immediately, digesting it within seconds of you swallowing. It seems the pill's effects are still in effect. So you have to keep eating, the wolf reminds you as he checks up on you.

It takes almost two hours for you to feel full again, and you've in that time cleared almost every dessert, finally scraping the last pieces of pie and sighing as you finish the 13th. On the plus side, you've made $600 today; on the negative side, your automatic digestion has caused you to gain more than 80 pounds, now completely filling out your work uniform, stretching the sweatpants' rope string.

The wolf congratulates you and hands you another set of clothes. It's a 3X.

Your stomach growls before you really think about it - the pills are still going to be in effect for a little while, and it might be better to get free food now than pay for food later, you think. Plus, you're honestly starting to enjoy the weight gain process, now that you're used to it - turns out Zaftig City's a nice place! Everyone's respectful and the vast majority of your customers are very nice. And your weight gain has slowed, too - sure, there's still a few pounds on your waistline every time you overeat your boundaries - but you're rising slowly, just a few pounds a week, a more manageable pace. Things are comfortable - you're even heading out to bars and local events, making a few friends here and there.

"Hmm... do you have any other shows?" you ask.

The elephant thinks for a moment. "You wouldn't happen to be a sous chef, would you?" he asks.

"Nope," you reply.

"Work a dangerous job?"

"No."

"Mine for gold?"

You shake your head.

The elephant goes back to thinking. "Wait a minute, I think I have an idea! 'Opposite, Attached!'"

"...'Opposite, Attached'?" you ask.

"Yes! It's one of the most highest rated shows on the network! Have you not heard of it? Each season, we find two individuals and have them live together. They compete in challenges every week and, if they win, earn prize money. Here's the gimmick: Every pair we choose is completely the opposite the each other in some way. Last season, we paired an opera diva who hates rap music with a rapper who doesn't like opera! It was hilarious! One of the challenges made them write a song together! Great television!"

"So, is this a show I can be on?" you ask.

"I think you can! We just need to find the right opposite for you, and I think we have a concept that will bring in the ratings!" The elephant sounds incredibly enthusiastic about this.

"Who would I have as an opposite?" you inquire.

"If I can pull some strings, I might be able to sign, get this, Brian The Binge King!"

You stare at the elephant for a moment. "Umm...who is Brian the...Binge King?"

A look of confusion crosses the elephant's face. "Have you been living under a rock or something? Brian the Binge King! The Lion Lord of Lard himself! He's only one of the greatest competitive eaters of this or any other generation! Last week, the guy devoured 107 hot dogs in under five minutes! It was a new world record!"

"But this doesn't make sense. I'm the opposite of a competitive eater?"

The elephant let out a loud laugh. "You haven't seen the guy, have you? He's absolutely massive. Easily, what, ten times your size? Brian doesn't bother getting weighted very often. I think he past a half-ton about two years ago. But that's where you two differ: Super skinny and super fat! Opposites... Attached! What do you say, pal?"
1123.title: Opposites... Attached?

113.content:
"Hey, Mark!" Another voice calls. "What're ya still doing here? We need our booth set up in just a few minutes!"

You and the pig- apparently named Mark- turn around to see an even bigger porcine lumbering towards you. He towers over you, and has a few inches on the smaller pig. There's little doubt this one's a full on razorback boar; large tusks jut out from under his mouth, and his leathery skin is covered in wiry brown hair. A gut bigger than your entire body bounces with each ponderous step, preceding the boar by a good foot, making the boar nearly as wide as he is tall. But his arms, legs, and chest look solid as oak trees, and nearly as wide. There's not a lot of definition, but the slightest bend in his arm makes rock-hard biceps larger than your head surge up. He arches his brow quizzically as he sees you; he's actually pretty handsome, with chocolate-brown eyes and a large, manly chin, his hair in a military-style buzzcut. The way he carried himself, he had an air of authority, and you felt yourself standing up straighter the longer he looks at you, like he's a drill sergeant about to start bellowing orders.

"Aw, bro, I was just making a new friend- look at him! He's all sticks and bones!" Mark says, patting your shoulder as his soft gut presses against you.

The larger boar glares, placing his hands on his wide hips. "Mark Densin, get yer fat ass in that van of yers, and get those hot dogs and burgers down here, or I'll tan yer hide!"

"Right, sorry!" Mark says with a small salute, giving you an apologetic look as he rushes off.

The larger boar shakes his head. "Ugh... little brothers, am I right?"

"Uhm... I wouldn't know, I think..." you mutter, rubbing the back of his head.

The boar eyes you, then juts out his thick, leathery hand. "Name's Trevor Densin, but most people 'round here call me 'Tank,' on account-a my time with the city defense force."

Yeah, sure, that's why, you think as your gaze glances again at his huge tankard of a gut. You take his hand, which completely envelops you; your whole body jumps as he shakes. "I'm, uhm..."

"Ya'll feelin' alright?" Tank asks. "My brother ain't lyin', ya look deathly ill, friend. Here, let's getcha somethin' to drink at least."

Tank's huge arm presses against your back as he guides you, like he's afraid you're about to fall over. "Keep with me, Red," he says, on account of your red fur, you suppose. "Won't do none to have ya pass out on one-a Zaftig City's best holidays."

"Holiday?" You echo, quirking your head.

"Psht, don'tcha know? Summer Festival starts today!" Tank gestures ahead, where the city's huge park has been taken over by a colorful array of tents and booths. Rides have been set up- most of them, you notice, curiously low to the ground- and a huge stage dominates the center of the festival.

"I-I wouldn't know," you mumble, still being guided by the boar. "I'm from out of town."

"Aha, that explains it." Tank chuckles, nodding to the people around you- he's caught you ogling the plus-size citizens, ranging from a little tubby to outright landwhales, huffing and puffing to move under their own power. "People 'round these parts a little heartier than where yer from, ain't they?"

"You can say that..." you concede, trying not to stare as you spot another fox five times your size greedily devouring a gallon bucket of fried chicken, holding it as dearly in his fat-swaddled arm against his heavy, doughy chest as if it was his firstborn child.

"Heh." Tank leads you to his own booth, which has rather cutesy cartoons of Tank and Mark's faces flanking big, bold lettering that reads "Densin Bros. Eats" "Well, Zaftig City's a good place. Good people. Densin family's been here from the start. My great grandaddy was the tenth mayor during the city's bicentennial, and his grandaddy was mayor before that," Tank says with pride, smiling and tugging at the lapels of his long-suffering shirt.

"So... where is Zaftig City, exactly? Worldwise?" You ask, cocking your head as Tank steps behind you, preparing something from a vat.

"Jeez, ya really are lost, ain'tcha Red?" He comes back with a huge glass of lemonade, setting it in front of you. "That should perk ya right up. Zaftig's an independent city state, sandwiched right between the US and Canada. Best damn farming anywhere, and there ain't no better place for food!"

"So... is that why everyone's so..." you puff out your cheeks, holding your arms out in a circle.

"Heh." Tank gives you a mysterious smirk. "Drink yer lemonade, Red, it's on the house."

You remember that gnawing feeling in your stomach, and take your first sip; the taste is almost overwhelming. It's almost too sweet, but that sharp, lemon-y tang, and a sprig of mint, you think, has you finish off the whole glass, feeling oddly refreshed, if still starving.

"Feel better?"

"Yeah, thanks so much, Tank." You grin up at the boar, nodding, then you feel like the wind's knocked out of you as Tank slaps you on the back.

"Good!" he grins, helping you to your feet. "Now go get some vitals in ya, Red. Ya still look like stiff breeze'll knock ya down. Go to any ol' booth, take yer pleasure. If they ain't handin' out free sample, ya'll just tell 'em ol' Red sent ya. But I want to see ya back here with some room in yer gut- yer gettin' a genuine Densin bros. burger if I have to hunt ya down and force it down yer gullet!"

You stumble out of Tank's booth, then shrug as you look around, craning your neck for something that strikes your fancy...
113.title: Zaftig City's Summer Festival

1132.content:
"Hey, little dude! Over here!"

Your eye catches a huge stag, but a very different kind of huge. He was a towering mass of muscle, with arms nearly as big as Tank's, but far more defined and sculpted, made up of vast rolling shoulders, swollen biceps, and a huge chest you could bounce a quarter off of, all packed into a tank top straddling his massive bust and solid torso. He wasn't entirely ripped; not competition ready, certainly. He was like an off-season bodybuilder, with a bit of healthy fat marring his sculpted form; apparently no one got out of living in Zaftig City unscathed. He was also a handsome devil, with a strong chin and sculpted face, and a giant pair of antlers speaking to his virility, but the dullness in his grey eyes marked him as remarkably dumb.

Taken by the sight of him, you move closer, and he smiles. "Awesome! You're our first customer of the day, bro. And you look like you could use a piece of cake or three." You can spot some similarly well built and musclebound guys, busy unpacking all kinds of snacks behind the stag, but he was the biggest by a good margin.

"Who're you guys, and what're you selling?" You ask, clearing your throat and trying not to stare at him.

"We're the Beta Upsilon Phi frat, man!" He flexes his arm, his bicep swelling up to a monstrous size. "B, U, F! Spells buff, hah."

"Buff has two F's, Zach, you meathead," one of the Frat brothers shouted from the back.

"Pft, whatever, man." Zach smirked, then gestured to the counter, laden with all kinds of delectable baked goods; cookies, brownies, pies, and cakes. A huge chocolate cake caught your eye in particular. "We're doing a bake drive, bro. See anything you like?"

Your stomach grumbles intensely enough you have to grip it, your mouth watering. "T-tank, Tank Densin sent me, said he was good for it?"

"Big Tank?" Zach brightens up. "Oh yeah dude, he's cool. Take whatever you want!"

You are starving, and the tantalizing smell is driving you crazy as you snatch up the entire cake, the desert larger than your head. You shove some of the moist, gooey, sinfully rich cake into your mouth, relieved to have some real food at last. "How'sh a frat sho good at baking?" You ask, your mouth full of cake.

"Oh, training, man." Zach responds. "We all gotta do our part."

"Part?"

"Yeah, you know, man, for the city. Zaftig's gotta keep growing, or-"

"Zach, dude!" One of the frat bros, a buff bear that was carrying considerable more paunch in his middle than Zach, punches the stag in his arm. "Shut up! Can't you see he's out of town?"

"Huh?" You're about a third way through the cake, your muzzle covered in frosting. Your pants feel a little tight as your gut is packed with cake, but you're still starving.

"Uh... don't worry about it, bro," Zach said quickly. "Boring... politics stuff. How's, uh... how's the cake?"

"It'sh great!" You nod emphatically. It takes a few minutes of intense gorging as you sate your hunger, and the various frat bros begin peaking over Zach's huge shoulders to watch. When you're finally finished, you're sinking down to the ground, licking your fingers and rubbing your distended gut. "Ugh..." Best. Cake. Ever.

"Woah, dude!" Zach chuckles, leaning over the counter, shading you with his pecs. "That was awesome!" Some of the other frat bros cheer, two pairs of muscular arms hoisting you to your feet. "You gotta come to the frat house and do that again, cakebro!"

Slightly light-headed from the gorging, you stagger away from the BUF bros as they slap you on your back. Well, at least you're getting popular...

The way Zach was hushed up, though, has you suspicious. Where do you go next?
1132.title: BUF Bake Drive

“Oh, he still runs,” Mark nods. “He’s faster than me!”

“Everyone’s faster than you, Mark,” Tank rolls his eyes. “But being big in Zaftig, it’s a status symbol. Gotta show off how much you can afford, how rich you’re makin’ the city, because that’s the deal we made- the more we eat, the richer the city gets.”

Tank and Mark exchanged looks, then shrugged. “We don’t know. The Elders do, but they don’t say why.”
