You rinsed off, turned off the water, and shook yourself dry. Wrapping a towel around your waist, you exit the bathroom to get some food.

Sitting on your oversized bed were two pizza boxes, each holding a pizza around three feet in diameter. James was sitting cross-legged in front of one tearing into what had to be his third slice. His grey and white muzzle was stained with grease and tomato sauce.

"Dude!" you say, gesturing to the second pizza, "I thought you were going to get something cheap like a personal pizza! We can't splurge our money in food!"

James chopped down the rest of his slice. 'Relax. This is a personal pizza! I even asked the delivery guy if he screwed up our order or something. Apparently, that's how they make them here. And they were pretty cheap anyways. Now, sit your butt down and dig in to your pizza. It's really amazing! It tastes great! Oh! And I found a channel that's playing Knives of Justice 2! I love that movie!"

James was right; the pizza was absolutely amazing. Easily some of the best you've ever had. You two ate your respective pizzas in silence while watching the movie. Well, you ate in silence. The occasional burp and moan of pleasure escaped James as he practically inhaled his pizza with reckless abandon. His fur was stained with dots of red and grease and crumbs. His black shirt was balled up on the floor, so all the mess landed on James chest and noticably swollen belly.

When he was finished, James let out a low, rumbling belch. "God, that hit the spot..." he said as he lazily rubbed a paw against his pizza-filled gut. "Say what you will, but these fatties know how to make a good pizza..."

You had only eaten about two thirds of your pizza and you were already painfully full. And, unlike James, you were careful not to mess up your clean fur with sauce and grease. The food was great. But you didn't want to eat yourself to the point of vomiting. You closed up the box and laid back in bed noticing your own stuffed belly, though it was not as round and full as James'.

You watched the movie, but James eyed your remaining slices like the wolf he was. The pizza, you thought, would make a decent breakfast tomorrow. But it looks like James is really eagar for more.
1321111.title: A duo to take on Zaftig City

choices: Confront James
Just let the whole incident go
13211111.content:
It's your pizza. If James wants more that's too bad for him.

You get up from the spacious bed and grab the pizza box being sure the mutter something about saving it for the morning just loud enough for James to hear. You stick your leftovers in the mini fridge of your hotel room.

Drowsiness from your meal is hitting you hard, so you hop back into bed and pull the covers over you after unwrapping your towel from around your waist. Sleep takes over you as James continues watching television, the occasional burp escaping his sauce-stained muzzle.

A dreamless sleep is ended when you suddenly find yourself awake in your room which is completely dark aside from beams of streetlight filtering in through the room's closed blinds.

Looking over to the other side of the bed, you see that James isn't there. Before you can wonder where he went, you hear the sounds of cardboard rustling from the other side of the room. You look over in that direction and see the dark silhouette of the wolf's bare backside and grey furry tailing swaying happily left and right.

The greedy creature seems to be helping himself to your food. Or, at least, he was helping himself to your food. You hear the sound of the mini fridge's door shutting as James stands upright, an empty pizza box in one paw and the crust of a slice in his other. He stuffed the final bit of pizza into his maw has he lazily tossed the box in the direction of the trash can. As James quitely stepped back towards the bed, you catch a glimpse of his rounded belly which looked even more bloated than it did hours ago.

The bed jostles slightly as James slides back in. Rolling on to his side, you hear a final rumbling burp come from him.

You're annoyed that he stole your food. This might just be a laspe in judgment for him, or it could be a sign that James has some problematic behaviors.
13211111.title: A greedy grey wolf

choices: You wake up several hours later feeling much better
You feel miserable for the rest of the day
132111111.content:
When James settled back down into your shared expansive bed, you reaches your leg out and gave him a light kick on the rump. A surprised yelp confirms your foot hit its target.

"Ow! What was that for?" yelled James.

"For eating my pizza!" you yelled back. "You know I was saving that for tomorrow!"

"Sorry! But I was still hungry!" explained James. "Look, I make it up to you tomorrow, I promise!"

"Yeah, yeah," you said dismissively. Rolling back over, you draw the cover close to you and fall back asleep.

In the morning, you're woken up by someone jostling your shoulder. Wiping the sleep from your eyes, you see James is standing over you on your side of the bed. He's holding open large pink box. Inside were donuts, though significantly bigger than usual. You quickly counted nine of them and assume that James must have eaten some while you asleep. That suspicion was confirmed when you noticed the crumbs on his shirt and a stain of what looked like blueberry jelly still on this muzzle.

"Breakfast!" announced James. "See, I told you I'd make it up to you!"

"Uh, thanks." You grab a maple bar that you swear is a few inches longer and rounder than they're usually made.

"No, take them all!" James hands you the entire box. You sit upright in bed and rest the box in front of you and you start on the maple bar. "Well, unless you want to share..." the wolf suggested. "I had a couple, but how can only a couple of donuts count as a decent breakfast, right?"

For a moment, you consider sharing them with James. But then again, you want to teach this greedy wolf a lesson.

"I dunno..." you said melodramatically. "I mean, I'm so hungry this morning. Maybe if I had some pizza or something, I wouldn't need all of these." James averted his eye with the obvious jab at him. "Besides, you're absolutely right. A couple of donuts isn't a decent breakfast, and it is the most important meal, after all!" With that, you tore into the rest of your maple bar.

James turned on the television to distract himself from the treats he's missing out on. Yet you're not done making him suffer just yet."

"Oh, this one has sprinkles! I love sprinkles!" You take a huge bite of the donut. "Dohft yeh lahk sprinklughs?" You ask just with your mouth full; he ignores you.

"Ah man, lemon! My least favorite filling!" James ears perked up. "Oh well, waste not want not!" His ears go back down.

"Oh good! Bavarian cream! My favorite! No way I'd share this one!"

With each donut, you mercilessly tease James about how tasty and delicious they are and what he's missing out on. Judging by the look on his face, you can tell you've gotten under his skin. By the time you swallowed the final chunk of the ninth donut, you're suddenly aware of how much you've eaten and how incredibly full you are. Your gut, which had been deflated slightly from last night's dinner, is back to being tight as a drum and looks as if you'd eaten an overinflated basketball. Pain radiated from your belly, and you kicked the box away and laid back down in bed as your paws gently rubbed your bloated abdomen.

Hearing your soft moans of pain, James looked away from the television and saw your extremely stuffed form. The wolf couldn't help but smile knowing your evil little plan backfired.

"Aww...poor baby," he cooed. "Does your tum-tum hurt from all that sugar?" You threw a pillow at him which he easily dodged. "I'm actually impressed you ate them all. Those donuts were huge. I've never seen a bear claw the actual size of a bear's claw." He got up from the bed and wandered next to you. "Well, I was going to suggest we go out hunting for work. But I guess you'll have to sit today out because, well..." The wolf gave your belly a pat which made you moan a little in pain as you weakly nod. "Then I guess I'll head out on my own. If you're feeling any better, try and find work. The sooner we get a steady flow of cash, the better." Again, you nodded weakly and James exited the apartment.

Sleep is probably the best option for you. So you rolled over onto your side, feeling the contents of your completely stuff belly shift, and closed your eyes.
132111111.title: Revenge is sweet until it gets sour

choices: Ask James if he could get you a job at the bakery
Find other work on your own
1321111111.content:
The digital clock the nightstand read 5:27pm when you woke up again. The first thing you noticed was that your belly was no longer in intense pain. Tossing the blankets off your nude body, you saw that your swollen belly has shrunk considerably. In its place, however, was a thin layer of soft pudge. No belly, by any means. But your midsection did carry a bit more plushness than it did because.

"Makes sense," you said to yourself while poking and prodding your flabbier abdomen. "The pizza, the donuts, the fact that I hardly left the bed since yesterday..."

Minutes later and you're standing under in a hot shower, letting the water rinse away the crumbs and sugar left in your fur from this morning. Certain that your fur is free from debris, you unhook the detachable shower head from its handle to give the rest of your body a rinse. Then you hold the shower head so the steaming hot water is directly pointed at your belly which hours ago felt threatening to burst. The hot water felt amazing on your stomach, and your free paw started gently rubbing your midsection. Small circle rubs became wider and wider until you realized your paw was headed pretty far south. Dirty thoughts danced around in your dirty mind, and you got hot and bothered in that hot shower. "James is gone, and I have the place to myself..." you thought to yourself. "Might as well release some stre-"

The slamming of the door to your hotel room rudely interrupted your thoughts. You sighed in frustration and quickly finished your shower. "Note to self," you thought while drying yourself off. "Don't get yourself worked up unless you know you're going to be alone for a while."

With a towel wrapped around your waist, you left the bathroom to see James lounging on the bed watching television. You immediately noticed that he was clad only in a new-looking pair of black boxer briefs that he didn't have yesterday, and several shopping bags sat on the floor next to him. You also saw a small roll of fat pouring over the waistband of his underwear. He was munching on a cheese Danish the size of a small dinner plate when he saw you.

"Hey, feeling better?" he asked.

"Much better, yeah. Any luck finding a job?"

"Luck, oh man I got lucky today," James began as you joined him on the bed. "So, get this. I'm heading back to that bakery I got breakfast from today because I was still a little hungry and someone wouldn't share. So when I got there, the whole place was in panic mode. All the employees were freaking out. Something about all of their oven malfunctioning. As soon as I walked in, the manager grabs my arm and drags me into the back. Here's the thing: All of their electrical equipment was malfunctioning and they needed someone to slip between some of their huge machinery and work some switches on their breaker panel. But, surprise surprise, everyone who works there's is a gigantic fat ass. But me and my slim frame easily fit in there, so I flipped a few switches, dialed a few knobs, and everything's fixed. I'm the hero of the day! The owner personally thanked me and asked if I need anything. I told him what I needed was a job, and the rest is history!"

"Wow, that's is really lucky. Wait, you know how to bake?"

James shook his head. "No, but they'll train me in a few week. I'll be working in the back doing some physical labor at first. Then their train me in the kitchen, and eventually I work the front. They want another guy there who can really be a jack-of-all-trades. They also gave me a bit of a 'signing bonus', so I was able to pick up some clothes on my way home. Do you realize that we have to go to a specialty store to get some clothes that'll fit around our skinny butts? I had to go to three stores before I found place that sold underwear that fit." He snapped the band of this boxers of emphasis. "Oh, and another benefit of my new job: Dibs on the day-olds!" James scarfed down the last bits of his Danish and reached for a brown paper bag on the floor beside him. "Baklava?" he asked you, holding up a piece the size of your paw. You nodded and he hands it off to you before reaching back in to pulling out a chocolate cake about ten inches in diameter. He pulled off it's plastic cover and starts devouring it.

It looked like James was in a good place. Now you needed to find a way to make money for yourself. You could ask James if they're hiring at the bakery. But that might be putting all your eggs in one basket. If anything happened, you'd both be out of a job.
1321111111.title: James the Baker?

choices: Eat the donut, and your half of the dozen
Refuse and let James eat the rest
132111112.content:
While it annoyed you that James was eating food that you clearly said was for you to eat later, you decided not to make a big deal out of it. Besides, he paid for it, and you don't want to rock the boat between the two you. You rolled over and drifted back off to sleep.

The next morning, you and James dressed in the clothes you acquired yesterday and left your hotel room to look for work. As you two dressed, you noticed the distended curve of his belly. Clearly, the wolf was still slightly bloated from the night before.

"After breakfast!" said James. "I can't go job hunting on an empty stomach!" Feeling a little peckish yourself, you agreed with the wolf. Apparently, your hotel was a few blocks away from a popular bakery. James offered to get breakfast, so you waited from him as you sat on a park bench nearby.

Around fifteen minutes later, the grey wolf came back carrying a bright pink box. He placed the box on the bench and sat down opposite to you. James opened it and inside were a dozen large donuts.

"Dig in!" James said enthusiastically. He reached in and grabbed a maple bar several inches longer and wider than you remember them being. You reached in and took a cruller. The two of you ate in silence, but you couldn't help but be aware of the rate James was scarfing down the donuts. By the time you finished your second one, he was biting into his fifth.

"You know, we should really take care of what we eat around here," you said to James as he shoved the last of his fifth donut into his maw. "I mean, all we've eaten since we've gotten here are pizza and donuts."

"Oh, relax," replied James. "Are you worried that you might put on a little weight here? Even if we did, both of us together would still weigh half as much as some of the tubs of lard here." He reached into the pink box again and pulled out a bear claw. James held the confectionery up to your nose. "Now, eat up. Breakfast is the most important meal of the day!"
132111112.title: Breakfast with James

choices: Check out Di Ravioli's
Ignore it and keep looking for work
1321111121.content:
"I guess I'm being a little paranoid," you said as you grabbed the bear claw from James. "We should still be mindful of what we're eating, just in case. Otherwise, we might blow up like a couple of furry balloons." James gave an apathetic grunt as he grabbed the last donut of his half of the dozen and started to devour it.

Half an hour later, you and James are wandering down the streets of Zaftig City, both of your bellies filled up on a breakfast of half a dozen donuts each. "So, where do you think we can find work?" you asked James.

He shrugged. "I know just as much about this city as you do," he replied. "Let's just see if anyone has a help wanted sign up." You two turned a corner, and James pointed out a sign for a business towards the end of the block. Di Ravioli's Pizza And Pasta, the sign read. "Oh hey, this is where I got last night's pizza." As you both got closer, you saw a pair of flabby tigers storm out of the front door of the restaurant.

"AND YOU CAN MAIL US OUR CHECKS!" one of the obese tigers screamed.

"WORST. JOB. EVER." yelled the second tiger. Both them stormed down the sidewalk loudly grumbling to each other.

You and James look to each other. "Should we go in and see what's what?" asked James.
1321111121.title: On the Job Hunt

choices: Go with the healthy options for dinner
Splurge and buy some junk food
13211111211.content:
A corpulent black panther paced back and forth from behind this host's booth angrily mutter to himself as you and James walked into Di Ravioli's. His doughy gut oscillated up and down with every pounding step the fur made. When he saw you both walk in, he steeled himself and put on his best customer service smile.

"Hello, gentlemen. Welcome to Di Ravioli's. Table for two? Apologizes in advance. Service may be a bit slow today. We, uh, suddenly found ourselves short-handed."

"Oh, really?" said James while feigning ignorance. "What happened?"

"I had to fire a couple of idiots I should have fired a long time ago," the panther said. "Let's just leave it at that."

"Oh, really?" James was really putting it on. "Why, it just happens to be the case that a couple of young, hard-working guys are looking for some work." The wolf gestured to you both.

"Is that so?" the panther asked.

"Oh, yes! We can even start today!" You nodded in agreement.

"What do you need us to do?" you asked.

"Nothing too complicated. For one, I need a dishwasher. Someone to make sure the wait staff have clear plates and forks and that the chefs have clean pots and pans. And I need someone to work in the storeroom. This include unloading deliveries, keeping ingredients stocked, and doing some prep work for the chefs."

"Oh! Oh! I call dishwasher!" James said enthusiastically. You gave James an odd look. He leaned into you and whispered, "Given the size of the fatties in this city, I don't expect anything but plates licked clean coming back." You understood his logic.

The panther turned to you and asked, "Interested in working in the storeroom, then?"

"Sure, work is work."

"Wonderful!" the panther exclaimed. "I'm Mark, and I guess I'm your new manager." He gave both of your outfits a glance. "Since you'll be working in the back, there really isn't any sort of dress code so long as you keep yourself clothed. But I suggest spending your first paycheck on something that isn't sweatpants and basketball shorts." The panther gestured at your clothes.

"Speaking of first paychecks..." James injected.

"You'll get paid cash at the end of each day. I don't normally do this, but consider it a favor for filling it on such a short notice." Mark said. "Now, let's get you to the back and acquainted with everything before the lunch rush hits..."

*****

It was early in the evening when your shift at Di Ravioli's ended. James was already outside the restaurant waiting for you.

"Not bad for a day's work," said James, holding up a small wad of cash.

"Not bad instead," you said, holding up your's.

"Indeed. How was work?"

"It's alright. Lot's of lifting and I'm on my feet all the time. You won't believe how much mozzarella this place goes through in a day. But at least I might put on a little muscle here." You rolled up the sleeve of your skinny arm and flexed a non-existent bicep.

"Well, I might develop permanently pruned paws working here..." James whined.

"Hey, you were the one so eager for the job," you replied.

"True, true. And it has some added benefits. Some customer sent back a pizza they complained was burnt. It wasn't; they were just being picky. Anyways, they wanted me to throw the whole thing away. And I did...after snagging a few pieces for myself!"

You rolled your eyes at him. "Pizza, again?"

"I was hungry! Besides, I'm a growing boy!" said James.

"Yeah, and you will be if you stuff yourself full of pizza everyday."

James stuck his lounge out at you. "Anyways, give me some of your cash. Yesterday, I found a store that might sell clothes that actually fit us. We're pretty much the same size, so I'll pick up stuff for the both of us. You go get dinner since I got it yesterday. I think there's a grocery store around here."

You agreed with the plan and handed James some of your money. The two of you went your separate ways.

After fifteen minutes, you found the supermarket James mentioned. Wandering up and down the aisles, you looked for what to bring back to your hotel room for dinner. Unfortunately, your options weren't that great since you don't have kitchen to work with. The supermarket sold some pre-made dinner salads and wraps. They also had a full deli that sold the usual: Corn dogs, potato wedges, deep-fried burritos, and chicken strips.

Convinced that these are pretty much your few options for dinner, it's time to decide what to have. Those salads look good, and it would probably be the healthier choice. James will probably whine about salad for dinner, but you two need something to counter how poorly you two have been eating. On the other hand, maybe today is a day to cut loose a little and splurge on something less healthy. After all, there is reason to celebrate: You and James managed to find a job in a single day.
13211111211.title: Off the Job Hunt

choices: Let James take the job
Take the job for yourself
13211111212.content:
"Nah, let's keep looking," you said. "I don't think we need to swoop in and take the first job we can find. And we can always check in tomorrow if nothing pops up today."

"True, true," James agreed.

For the next few hours, you two wandered the streets of Zaftig City searching for work. Unfortunately, every single establishment you approached wasn't hiring. You and James were getting worried that the job market was really tight here until you saw a help wanted sign hanging outside of a warehouse. Painted on the side of the building was ZAFTIG CITY METROPOLITAN IMPORT-EXPORT.

You two entered and saw an open building filled with boxes of various shapes and sizes. Dozens of furs were carrying boxes around, loading them onto trucks, putting new boxes where there was space. Each fur was very beefy with thick pecs and bludging biceps, but all were sporting substantial ball guts.

You only take a few steps in before you hear an intimidating yell. "HARD HATS AND SAFETY VEST ON AT. ALL. TIMES." The voice was from a girthy cheetah who was angrily approaching you two.

"Woah, woah. We're here because of the help wanted sign outside. Are you hiring?" asked James.

"Oh, you are? Good," the cheetah said. "We're hiring for a delivery assistant. It's simple. You help load the trucks. You help unload the trucks. Pays cash at the end of the day, and it pays well."

"A delivery assistant? As in, just one?" you asked.

"Yes, just one. The higher ups are complaining about how much is spent on labor, otherwise I'd hire a dozen and a half more people. For now, we're only hiring one because the eggheads upstairs think that we'll have just enough people to meet our quotas. But I don't see them down here working their butts off. We're always barely meeting deadlines. Seriously, I can hire one of you today, right now, just as fast as it can take you to fill out some paperwork."

James looked to you and said, "It looks like a decent job. I'm down, unless you really want it."
13211111212.title: Keep on keeping on

choices: You wake up the next morning feeling great
You have a bizarre dream that night
132111112121.content:
Judging by the furs currently working the floor and from what the cheetah in charge said, it appeared to you that this place drives their employees like slaves. You don't oppose doing hard labor, but you felt that this place doesn't exactly have the best working environment.

"Go ahead and take it," you said to James. "I'll keep on looking."

"Alright, good luck. I guess I'll see you tonight." James turned to the cheetah. "So I'll take the job, then!"

"Fantastic;" the cheetah said jovially. He placed a paw around James' shoulder and led him upstairs. "Okay, let's get you set up with HR. Oh, and we'll get you a hard hat and safety which must be worn at all times..." The cheetah's voice trailed off as he and James went up to the offices.

Several hours later and your feet are aching from pounding the pavement. Sitting on a park bench, you had taken a break from job hunting. Every single place you went into wasn't hiring. Disappointed and exhausted, you began thinking about where else to look for work when your stomach let out a loud grumble. It was then you realized that you hadn't eaten anything since that morning. You dug into your shorts pocket and found that you had a few bucks on you. No enough for a meal, but maybe a snack.

You recalled that a couple of blocks away was some kind of ice cream place. The old fashioned interior had caught your attention as you walked by. It looked exactly like one of those old timey malt shops.

"Maybe some ice cream would cheer me up," you thought to yourself as you got back onto your feet.

The ice cream shop was empty sans a very overweight zebra wiping down the counter that ran the entire length of the store. Red vinyl booths lined the opposite wall and tables and chairs filling in the space in between. In one of the far corners stood a jukebox; it appreaded to be in working order. Photos of celebrities and musicians from generations ago filled the walls. You could tell that this place was very nostalgia-inducing.

"Come in, come in!" the zebra said, gesturing to the empty stool on the opposite side of the counter to him. As you approached, you saw he was wearing white pants with a black belt the former of which clung to his bubble butt and tree trunk-like thighs. You could practically heat the seems of his pants scream as they strain to contain his weight. A tail plump as a sausage hung lazily over his rump. His white button-up shirt was struggling to contain his girth; white and black stripes of fur poked out between the overworked buttons. Two mighty slabs of flab rested on the gargantuan belly. A smile was on his face though it was slightly hampered by his puffed up cheeks. A thick collar of pudge surrounded his neck.

"Welcome, welcome!" he said as you sat down on the stool, which you noticed was far wider than expected probably on account of the size of the patrons who come here. "What can I get you?"

"I'm in the mood for ice cream," you said. You looked at the wall behind the zebra but couldn't find a sign or board saying the flavors in stock. "Umm...what do you have?"

The zebra slid a laminated menu over to you which listed all of the flavors. It was a long list, probably over a hundred flavors.

"Oh God, that's a lot," you said. "How can you have so many flavors in stock?"

"We have a pretty big freezer in the basement. It's able to store hundreds of flavors!"

"So you go down to the basement anytime someone orders?"

"Nope. We have a mechanical system that picks out a particular tub and brings it up. Its pretty nifty! I'll show you! Pick a flavor!"

"Hmm...Chocolate Catastrophe? Nah. I think I want something fruity...um...Bananafana? Maybe...Umm...I think I'll have two scoops of the...ah, Blueberry Kaboom!"

"Good choice, good choice!" said the zebra. "That's...Number 113, yes? It should say right next to the name." You nodded and the zebra punched a couple of digits in a keypad mounted to his side of the counter. Suddenly, you could slightly hear the whirring of machinery coming to underneath, and in a few moments a panel in the counter opened up and out popped a large container of light blue ice cream freckled with plump frozen blueberries. The zebra grabbed a glass bowl from behind him and placed two large scoops in the bowl each the size of softballs. He stuck a spoon into the bowl and slid it over to you.

"Thanks!" you said as you ate a large spoonful of the ice cream. "Wow! This is really good! I love the blueberries in it! Really gives it a kick!"

"Yeah, it's good. Oddly enough, it's one of the least popular flavors on the menu. I'm not sure why."

"Well, I guess everyone else is missing out!" you said between spoonfuls of ice cream. "Oh man, I needed this..."

"Rough day? he asked as he wiped down the already pristine counter.

"Long day, more like it." You swallowed another big spoonful. "I've been on my feet all day looking for work. I, uh, just...moved here, and I need to make some money. But it seems like hardly anyone is hiring."

The zebra's ears perked up. "Oh yeah, the job market has been pretty tight recently. What kind of work are you looking for?"

"Anything really."

"Maybe even working in, say, an ice cream parlor?"

"What do you mean?"

"Here's the thing," the zebra began. "During the late afternoons until we close, this place is completely full. I need someone to help do things like clean tables, run orders out, run the dishwasher, pretty much all the other stuff I can't do because I'm too busy behind the counter. I hired this young guy a few weeks ago, but he only shows up half the time and I have the feeling he's probably not going to come in again. If you're reliable and want work, the job is yours. You can even start today!"

You took a moment to think. Your job prospects have been pretty dire, and you need a work soon. This is a golden opportunity you don't want to throw away.

"You know what, I'll take it!" you said.

"Wonderful!" exclaimed the zebra. "I'm Jeff, and I guess I'm your new manager! Oh, and..." The rotund zebra grabbed your now empty bowl and put three more large scoops of Blueberry Kaboom in. "Consider it a 'signing bonus'!"

When you finished your ice cream, Jeff put a sign on the door saying "Be Back In 15".

"Not like it'll matter. This place is dead until the post-dinner rush," he said.

Jeff brought you to the back and got you a uniform: White shirt and slacks with a black belt to match his uniform exactly. Unfortunately, even the smallest size he had in stock was too big. But with safety pins and creativity, Jeff made it fit.

For the next two hours, the zebra trained you in all your duties just in time for a rush of obese furs. The entire place was packed until closing. You zipped between tables, cleaning them off only to have more furs occupy them again. You made sure Jeff had enough clean bowls and glassses and he served up ice cream and sundaes and milkshakes at a speed that astounded you considering his immense size. The frantic work pace kept until the doors shut. After sticking around to help Jeff with some of the closing responsibilities, he paid you and sent you on your way home.

"See you tomorrow!" he said, waving a flabby arm in the air.

It was just after 10pm when you got back to your hotel room. Crumpled on the floor were James' clothes soaked in the sweat. The grey wolf was laid up in bed moaning.

"So, how was the first day of the job?" you asked James, pulling off your own clothes. Jeff let you store your uniform at the shop.

"Ugh...I'm in so much pain. Every single muscle aches."

"Well, ice yourself with this." From a brown paper bag you had with you, you pulled out a large container of ice cream. Jeff let you take some home with you as a sign of appreciation for your hard work. You tossed the container to the wolf as well as a plastic spoon.

"Aww, sweet!" he said. "Wait, where do get this from?"

"I landed a pretty nice job at this ice cream place," you said. "Wages are good, the owner is nice, and I get to bring ice cream home."

"Good, I feel like I need an ice cream hook-up working at that warehouse." James looked at the label on the container. "Cookie Dough Apocalypse. Huh. Weird name." He shrugged, tore off the lid, and started eating.

You pulled your own container out from the bag: Blueberry Kaboo. You leaped onto the bed and began eating; the whole thing was gone in few minutes. Pretty soon you were asleep, deep in an ice cream induced coma.
132111112121.title: A Sweet Opportunity

choices: Have dessert with Jeff
Kindly decline
1321111121211.content:
It early in the afternoon when you strolled into the ice cream shop feeling rested and refreshed after a long night of sleep. The store was set to open in about an hour, and Jeff was at his usual spot behind the counter wiping a rag against the immaculate surface.

"Hey, hey!" the tubby zebra said. "Good to see you! Come and sit! What are you having today?" He gestured to the stool on the opposite side of the counter to him.

"Oh? I wasn't planning on getting anything," you began. "Besides, it's a bit early for ice cream, isn't it?"

"Nonsense, nonsense!" he said. "Come pick out a flavor, on the house! What better way to start a long hard day of work than with something sweet!"

You shrugged your shoulders. A little ice cream wouldn't hurt. And if you are going to be working here, knowing what some of the flavors taste like would be helpful. You sat down on the stool and glanced at the menu. "Umm...Marshmallow Madness sounds good!" you said after a few moments of glancing through all of the flavors. "It's number...067." Jeff punched the digits into the pad mounted into the counter and, in a few moments, a tub of ice cream appeared from the counter. An off-white concoction with miniature marshmallows frozen in it. The zebra grabbed a glass bowl from behind him and served up three large scoops for you. As you dug into the sickly sweet ice cream, Jeff punched in a few more numbers and a new kind of ice cream appeared. He scooped up a half a dozen scoops into a bowl for himself and waddled over to the stool next to yourself. His fleshy rump spilled over the sides of the seat as he sat down. You could have sworn you heard the stool groan under his weight.

"What kind did you get?" you asked in between bites, eyeing the ice cream in Jeff's bowl. It was white with many streaks of brownish-black rippling throughout. "Is that some kind of fudge ripple or something?"

"Nope. It's a personal recipe," he said. "I just make it for myself. It's too good to let just anyone have it. 'Ambrosia,' I call it. Wanna try?"

Intrigued, you dug your spoon into one of the many lumps of ice cream. A sly grin came across the rotund zebra's face as he watched the ice cream disappear into your awaiting maw. The taste, you realized, wasn't exactly clear. But it wasn't the taste that make this ice cream incredible. The moment it touched your tongue, your entire body is filled with a feeling a euphoria, an excited tingle running from your head to your toes. Your eyes closed in bliss as you savored the flavor.

"Good, isn't it?" Jeff said. You nodded silently. "You know what? I think you'll enjoy this more than me." He slid the bowl over to you. "Besides, I've had plent-" But before he could finish his sentence, you were already devouring the small mountain of ice cream. The obese zebra watched in delight as you mindlessly devoured it all in a matter of minutes. Jeff gave you a pat on your back as you licked the bowl clean.

"Alright, alright!" Jeff said. "That's enough for now. Change into your uniform, we'll be opening in a few minutes!"

*****

The next several hours at the ice cream shop were just as busy as your first shift yesterday. Perhaps it was even busier. Your day was a blur of rushing around the shop clearing tables and running the dishwasher to make sure Jeff had enough dishes to serve ice cream at the lightning fast pace he was working at. At one point the day, Jeff flagged you down as you were rushing into the back with an arm-load of dishes.

"Looks like I made a bit of a mistake," he said. "I left it in the back. It'd be a shame if anything went to waste." Jeff gave you a wink, though it was obscured by his puffy cheeks. In the back you found a bowl full of Ambrosia that Jeff had scooped up for you. Throughout the next hour, you shoveled mouthfuls of the stuff into your mouth, each spoonful as incredibly blissful as the last. You worked on it throughout your shift, though a few more scoops made it into the bowl every time you though it was almost done.

You were dead on your feet when the last customer left. You spent well over ten hours rushing around all over the place. As you caught your breath while sitting at the counter, Jeff waddled over to the door and turned off the open sign. "Not a bad day's of work," he said was he plodded over to the counter unbuttoning his shirt partly to expose his flabby black-and-white chest.

"Yeah...yeah," you said. It was bad enough that the place was so busy all day. But because of the ice cream he left out, you were working the entire shift with a belly full of sugar and cream, and now you were feeling slightly nauseous as your full stomach strained the buttons on your uniform. "I can't wait to get back home and sleep..." You got back up onto your feet.

"Wait, don't you want some dessert?" asked Jeff with a devious look on his face as he punched in some numbers into the digital pad, seconds later a tub of Ambrosia popped out.

While you did feel quite full, Ambrosia always sounds amazing. But you've eaten so much ice cream today that you should cut back a bit.
1321111121211.title: Another shift at the ice cream shop

choices: Have a rest in the booth
Chance it and head home
13211111212111.content:
"Ugh, I shouldn't, but...okay!"

"Great!" said Jeff enthusiastically. He grabbed a clean bowl and began filling it up with more softball-sized scoops of that amazing ice cream. As you take a seat at the counter, the rotund zebra slides the heavy bowl in your direction. Initially, you were unsure if your already tight and full stomach could handle that much more ice cream. But those concerns exited your mind as you shoveled more and more of the heavenly ice cream into your eager maw.

Jeff took a seat next to you, his rump spilling over the sides of the stool which looked comically small for a but his size. The zebra had made himself an equally large bowl of Ambrosia. "I hope you don't mind," Jeff began as he unbuttoned his tight white button-up shirt, exposing a cascade of soft black and white colored flabby rolls to the cool air of the shop. "I get a bit sweaty on busy days like this!" You glanced over to see the zebra's gigantic belly, but you simply gave an dismissive grunt as you focused back on devouring the rest of your bowl.

As soon as you finished stuffing the last bit of ice cream into you, you were painfully reminded of how incredibly full you were. You audibly groaned as you rubbed your swollen belly which was now straining the buttons on your shirt and resting on your lap.

Jeff, having just finished his own ice cream, chuckled at the sight you. "I guess I shouldn't have tempted you! You look like ill. If you want, you can lay down and rest in one of the booths. I've got plenty of cleaning to do before finally closing up. That is, unless you think you can make it home alright."
13211111212111.title: Giving into Ambrosia

choices: Tell Jeff what happened
Keep it to yourself
1321111121212.content:
You awoke to find yourself in a room with all white walls and no doors. In the center of the room was a small table and perched on top of it was a bowl with a single scoop of Blueberry Kaboom ice cream and a silver spoon. Cautiously, you walked over and picked up the bowl and spoon. Taking a bite of the frozen treat, your taste buds danced and soon the lone scoop was gone. Suddenly, the bowl, table, and spoon vanished, leaving you very confused.

A sharp pain erupted from your stomach and you doubled over. Was it the ice cream? Were you poisoned? Are you going to die? These questions raced through your head as the pain dissolved into numbness and that numbness spread out from your stomach out to your entire body. Then, that numbness turned into an intense tingling sensation starting at the tips of your paws and feet. You looked down and saw that your fur, usually a shade of bright red, was now turning light blue, then a deeper blue, then a dark violet.

You panicked as you watched your entire body change color, and when the last inch of red fur turned deep violet, a loud groan sounded from your belly. Placing a paw on your stomach, you immediately noticed that the once-flat surface of your stomach was now rapidly rounding out. In a matter of seconds, you looked nine months pregnant. You gave your belly a slap in disbelief and the mass wobbled while you heard loud sloshing inside you. As your belly grew and grew, you could feel your thighs swell up and press against each other, your arms soften, and your tail fighting for room with the ballooning orbs that was now your butt.

Terrified, you began running around the room to look for a way out. But the added weight was too much for you to carry around, and you collapsed onto your inflating butt exhausted and out of breath. Your blue-furred gut, now the size of a large boulder, forced you onto your back. You struggled to get up, but all that did was make your massive body jiggle uncontrollably.

A few minutes later and your body was entirely spherical. Your arms and hands were swallowed up by your round body, your feet pathetically stuck out, and your neck and cheeks were so swollen that you couldn't even move your head. Your vision was taken up by a vast horizon of blue fur and the white walls which appeared to be getting closer and closer. You felt your right flank press up against one of the walls, then your left flank. You realized you were getting to the size that you were outgrowing the room itself. Whimpering, you felt yourself fill up every single inch of space in the white room yet you were still filling out. Pressure built up, and you were sure that you'd pop any second. Another moment and you-

You woke up in your bed, covered in sweat. You threw off your blanket and ran into the bathroom. For the next several minutes, you splashed cold water on your face until you felt your heart rate result to normal. Now calm, you reached for a towel to dry off. That was when you noticed it: The very tip of your nose was a shade of blue now instead of its typical red.

You began to panic. The dream felt so real, and now your fur might be turning blue. Is there something wrong with that ice cream Jeff gave you? Are you having some sort of allergic reaction? Should Jeff know about this? Or maybe you're over reacting. Perhaps it best to keep this from Jeff. You don't want him to think that the fox he just hired is insane.
1321111121212.title: A Berry, Scary Dream

choices: Pry information from Jeff about the ice cream.
Get Jeff to eat some Blueberry Kaboom
13211111212122.content:
A large bowl with a half dozen scopes of the bright blue ice cream sat on the counter when you walked into the ice cream shop for your shift the next day.

"Hey, hey!" Jeff greeted you as he whipped the same spot on the counter with a dishrag. "It's gonna be really busy today, so I hope you're ready! Better make sure you have plenty of energy before we're slammed!" The zebra gestured towards the bowl piled high with ice cream.

"Oh, thanks..." you said, giving a half-hearted smile at the Blueberry Kaboom, hoping that your boss wouldn't notice the slight twing of blue on your muzzle. As Jeff scoped himself a huge bowl of ice cream, you sat on the stool, only taking a few nibbles of the treat.

"Is something wrong?" asked Jeff as he sat down on a stool next to you, his flabby butt hanged over the edges of his seat and you could have sworn you heard it groan under the weight of the quarter ton zebra. In front of him was a bowl full of bright white ice cream with loads of dark ripples in it. It may have been the same flavor he had yesterday.

"Oh, umm..." you stammered. "I was, uh, hoping to try a different flavor today. That's all." It was a lie but a decent one.

"Oops! Sorry! I should have asked what you wanted instead of assuming. You just seemed to enjoy Blueberry Kaboom yesterday so I figured you'd want it again today. But I'll remember next time! Until then, it'd be a shame if I had to throw out that perfectly good ice cream..."

You sighed as you grabbed your spoon and dug in. A smile creeped upon Jeff's chubby cheeks as he began devouring his own treat.

The ice cream itself was no doubt delicious. But you had no idea of it was doing to you, if it was actually doing anything to you. You wanted to be able forget it and stop worrying, but that dream was so vivid. You were so blue, so big, and only swelling bigger.

As you ate your ice cream in silence, you tried to figure out what to do. You might be able to pry some information from Jeff about what's in the Blueberry Kaboom. Maybe that will help you figure out what's going on with you. Or perhaps you can somehow trick Jeff into eating some. If he knows there's anything wrong with it, then he surely wouldn't eat it himself.
13211111212122.title: Keep it to yourself

choices: Restaurant
Machines
13213.content: Your growling belly startles you out of your touristy gazing and brings you back to an important matter, eating. You realize it feels like it's been days since you ate, so you decide to make your next move quickly. Immediately in front of you, there's a row of vending machines in a corner stall. To the left, there's a restaurant. You could go for a filling meal, but part of you thinks you're so hungry that waiting for your order to be ready could literally kill you.
13213.title: Find some food.

choices: Be cheap
Spend a little
132132.content:
Not having the patience to wait for a meal to cook, you decide to fill up on junk food and head over to the vending machines. Each drink and snack has a weird label that says + and then a number, with rising prices correlating to rising numbers. The cheapest items are $1 and say +5, and range all the way up to $10 for items with scores spanning from 10 to 100.

After looking through your options, you decide on your purchase - three snacks and a drink. You decide to get a bag of chips, a candy bar and some sort of pastry, along with a soda, but you still can't decide whether you want the basic food or the more expensive stuff.
132132.title: Machines

choices: Eat one
Eat it all
1321321.content:
You're just looking for something to stave off the hunger, and you should probably be looking to conserve what little money you have, after all, you only have 40 dollars, no job, and no place to sleep. You should really be thinking forward on how to make this last until you secure an actual source of income. You look over the options for the cheapest snacks. Below all the expensive snacks with the weird numbers, you spot a row of unmarked bars. They look like protein bars, though the brand you haven't heard of, each marked with 'Product of Abis Inc'. However, they are far cheaper than the stuff above. Your stomach growls and you decide it'll have to do, and at 50 cents a bar, it'll hardly put a dent in your limited wallet. You put in a dollar, and put in the number for one of the Abis bars. It drops into the bottom, and there is a jingle of your change as it drops into the coin slot. You fish it out, and notice there is a gold colored coin in your change. At first glance it looks like a souvenir coin or some sort, so you put it in your pocket and put the next 50 cents in the machine, and get another bar.

A jingle from the coin slot catches you by surprise, and you look to find another of those coins. Looking closer at them, you see 'ABIS PRIZE TOKEN' engraved on the edge. Curiously, you put in another dollar to get your third bar, and check the coins again. Sure enough, another of those tokens comes out in your change. Maybe this is some sort of promotional gimmick for the company brand? You're not sure what you can use these tokens for. You look over the coin, then the machine looking for some sort of instruction, but you don't really see any type of explanation. It has to have something to do with the machine, so you put the token into the coin slot to see what happens.

You hear the typical sound of a coin dropping into place, then three stars pop up on the small display that would usually display the price. One star is filled in with two others remain as outline. You put in the second token, and the stars flash again with the second star filled. You think you get it, it's like a 'buy three get something free' type deals. You put in the last token, and the third star lights up. The machine plays a short jingle and you hear something drop into the bottom. You check and fish out a fourth Abis bar, this one with shiny reflective lines on it and 'ABIS PLUS' emblazoned on it. Neat, free stuff. With all your bars, you think about what to do next, should you spread these out? Or are you hungry enough to just eat it all?
1321321.title: Never turn down free snacks.

choices: You wake up, and all is well...
You wake up, and something is off...
13213212.content:
Your stomach grumbles as if to answer you. You are starving, so you don’t delay in opening the bars and begin wolfing them down. They are thick and fudge, especially the free prize you got, but you don’t bother much with savoring them since you are so hungry, wanting to alleviate the empty feeling in your stomach as soon as possible. As they slide into your stomach, you feel much more relieved, giving a short sigh of relief before walking away to contemplate your next move. You need a job, and a place to live. Obviously you can’t really afford an apartment or hotel, so a job is the main focus for now. You could probably get a part time job or something at one of the stores along main street, so start heading that direction.

As you pass out of an alley, you huff a little, before a small belch escapes you, and you realize your feeling a little full. You guess those bars were a lot more potent then you realized. You look at the stores along the street, plenty of restaurants. You doubt that you could get a job at one of those fancy places, but a fast food place would be easy to get and solve the short term issue of money. You check the windows for any 'help wanted' signs, and spot one at a Pizza place. That would be perfect, you could probably even get some free pizza if they have left overs at the end of the day. You head over and walk in, and see a lion bent over behind the counter.

"Hey," you say, and see him rise up, for a moment wondering how the sun was rising inside the store, before realizing that that was merely the lions golden stomach spilling out from under an apron. "Hey, he says back, "What can I get you today?" His face looks friendly enough, with wobbly checks surrounded by a thick mane. You notice a name tag on his shirt, Lionard, and briefly wonder if that was a result of lazy naming, or if it was an intentional play on his species. "Um... I saw the help sign, I was wondering if the position was still open?" you ask. Lionard smiles, and you see his sharp teeth for the first time, and suddenly reconsider, wondering if his size was due to eating his employees. "Oh, I've been hoping for some help for a while. People get really intimidated by me, so I tend to scare off customers and potential employees." he says, and you feel a bit bad for thinking the same thing. "If your interested," he continues, "I'll take you right away, I need someone working the counter while I cook in the back!" His tone is enthusiastic, and your surprised at the strait forward offer and acceptance. "Wait," you say, a little blindsided, "Don't you want to ask me any questions, I mean, you don't know anything about me." It's an immediate offer, and your not one to look a gift horse in the mouth, but generally people at least asked for a name before hiring.

The lion laughs a bit, belly shaking, "I get it, but I've had that up for a year now, and you look trustworthy enough, and quite frankly, I'm too desperate to ask questions. I need a friendly face, and a fox looks far more charming and less intimidating then a sharp toothed lion." You have to admit, he has a point, the store looks pretty empty except for a few people in the back, the furthest place from the counter. You can imagine he's struggling to make a profit if he's scaring away everyone. "So if you want the position, you've got it." he says, opening the counter and waving you in, "We'll get you into a uniform and you can start right now." You have to blink a little in surprise. That was much easier then you thought. You step through and he leads you to the staff room...

-----

After a 4 hour shift, in which a number of people come in, and from the Lions reaction, was a drastic increase in the stores productivity, he hands you an envelope. You check inside and find a load of bills, "Wait, this is far too much for a paycheck," you say, surprised. "Call it an incentive," he says, "This was the best day in I can't remember how long, just keep coming back, and I'll make sure your taken care of." he says. "In fact, here's a special thank you gift just for you," he says, and stacks three pizza boxes into your arms. You hardly know what to say, but obviously this seems like a great position. "Thank you," is all you can really say.

You go back to change into your cloths, thinking you'll now be able to actually buy some instead of stealing. As you tug up your pants, you have a brief weird feeling. Do they feel a bit... tighter then before? You look in the mirror, turning this way and that. You are thin as a rake... well, at least you thought that was the case, you hadn't really examined yourself in a mirror till now, you look normal, not the malnourished skin and bones as you originally thought you must be. Of course, these are new clothes your not used to, so it must be your imagination. You finish getting dressed and take the pizza, then head out and check into a hotel. Thankfully your 'paycheck' gives you plenty to work with for a while. And hey, you have free dinner to boot, which you have your fill of before you go to bed, ready to go back to your new job the next day...
13213212.title: Now full, let's find a job...

choices: Find some entertainment...
Get into your work...
132132121.content:
Your alarm goes off in the morning, and you yawn and stretch, getting up and showering before putting on your clothes. You are hungry, still realizing you haven't gone grocery shopping, a few slices of cold pizza fill in, and you make the mental note to get some shopping done after work. Things go swimmingly, you man the front counter and dish out pizza without incident. Lio even gives you a free slice for lunch. Not much, but good enough.

After work, you look for a grocery store, eager to stock your pantry. The first one you find is B&L(Bulk and Large) which seems good enough. The prices are pretty good for a bulk store, allowing you to get almost 3 times the amounts you would have expected. Waiting in line you can't help but notice that the other customers more often hen not seem... uh hum... 'Horizontally challenged'. The guy in front of you is so wide you would not even be able to see the line... if not for the even fatter guy in front of him. You guess some people have moderation issues with the low prices here. When your items are scanned, the cashier offers you a store card, which would save you even more money, which you eagerly sign up for. When you get to your apartment, you stock your shelves and finish off the last of the pizza for dinner. Then you head to bed for the next day.

The rest of the week seems uneventful, you go to work, now with lunch in tow. The pizza place becomes more popular with you behind the counter, just as Lio expected, and you and he get along just fine as you spend afternoons familiarizing yourself with the area before going home and preparing your dinner from one of the frozen microwave meals you got from the store. Despite being tasty, it doesn't seem particularly filling at times, leading you to sometimes dip into a second one, or top yourself off with some of the snacks. But by the end of the week, you feel pretty much settled in and ready to make this a fresh start...
132132121.title: Work week

choices: Well, you DO like food...
Games, obviously...
1321321211.content:
With a steady income at your back and food sorted, you feel like you should be able to indulge in some hobbies. Work is great and all, but you would get bored with just that. So you go out on the town to see what else you can do in this city. Your explorations into the surrounding area have yielded one thing... people here are really into food. The number of restaurants, grocery stores, and food stalls around here means you can't cross a street without being offered a free sample, not that that is a bad thing. If you had known this beforehand, you wouldn't have been so worried about food, because a free lunch is easy to find. But more evidence of the love of food here is the sheer amount of 'ample' individuals, the store owners who obviously sample their own wares a bit too often, and the customers who are more often than not munching on something as they buy something else to start on.

As such the most obvious pastimes around here revolve around food. Eating competitions, restaurant sampling, cooking competitions, and other such events are practically plastered on every billboard. Of course, this also seems to mean gyms are sparse, as the calorie enriched denizens seem to indicate. You'll have to be careful if you don't want to end up spoiling your figure.

But then, aside from this, you find another avenue in which you could spend your energy, as you find a small street of video game stores. Obviously, this doesn't seem as popular as all the food-related events, but it's something that you can easily enjoy. Though not as prevalent, they do have the latest in games and gaming consoles, which cries out to your inner geek as you see they even have virtual reality headsets for sale.

In the end, you seem left with two options, the only question is will you dive into the more prevalent culture, or into the gaming one...
1321321211.title: Find some entertainment...

choices: Find the company.
Ride it out.
132132122.content:
The alarm clock by the bed goes off, waking you from your pleasant slumber. You paw out from under the covers blandly reaching for the off button before the shrill ringing is silenced. You sit up and stretch, yawning before getting up, stomach growling. You have left over pizza on the side table, so grab that for an easy breakfast, taking a bite as you head to the bathroom. You pass by the mirror to relieve yourself. Something nags you a little as you do your business and flush. You hop in the shower and wash, then dry yourself off and head to the mirror to get yourself ready. It’s only then you realize something is off. As you brush your teeth, you suddenly catch sight of your body. At first you didn’t notice, but them, your hands go to your stomach.

It’s not much, but you defiantly manage to cup a double palmful of flesh. Looking over yourself, where yesterday you were skinny, now you defiantly put on a thin layer of pudge. Your not fat, but you defiantly have the physique of a couch potato. Pizza wasn’t that fattening, there’s no way that caused this. Could it? You don’t really have time to investigate further, you need to get to work. You get your cloths and pull it non, noting that this time there is definite tightness, as you struggle to button your pants, with your flesh bulging out as you manage it. Even the shirt feels a little tighter, and you can see the fabric stretching slightly around your middle. Even so, you head to the pizza restaurant.

——-

“Great job,” says Lionard, after another day of increased customers. After replacing him at the counter, it seems his business has started booming, with the store at least half full for most of the day. You are keep busy enough to momentarily forget this morning, at least until lunch time where you hesitate about eating the complimentary slice offered you. Eventually you settle for a slice of veggie thin crust. After work, the events of the morning catch up with you, and you take a quick... tour of the kitchen, just to check on what exactly went into the pizzas. Lio is happy to give you the tour, and goes into detail about every single thing in the kitchen, from ingredients to equipment, to the point that you almost regret suspecting the pizza. It's clear Lio has had no company for a while.

Even so, when you go to get changed, you eyes immediately go for the mirror, as a cold sweat hits you, as you see that once again you look... thicker then before. As you pull on pants, you have to suck it in, the button straining now to contain your stomach which hangs slightly over it, and peaks out from under your shirt. As you head out, Lio hands you another couple boxes of pizza. You try to turn him down, but he is insistent. You stop by the clothing store and by some larger clothing before heading to the hotel. After you eat dinner, you examine yourself in the mirror again, noting your face is looking slightly more pudgy. You think back on what happened, and wonder what was in those bars you ate, which are the only other thing you can think of that may be the cause. Of course you've never heard of Abis Inc, but maybe you should look into it.

You sit down at the desk in the hotel room, a laptop chained to the desk as you open it to access the internet. You type in the company name, and immediately come up with a result" Abis Inc, a nutrition company that manufactures the latest in body satisfaction products. You dig in your pocket for the wrappers of the candy bars you ate. You look at the nutritional information, expecting a high calorie count or something. Surprisingly, there is normal nutritional information. You check over the ingredients, which also seem normal except a few chemicals you don't recognize. Except that is the last one, the free prize you got for the tokens. The list on that one covers the entire back of the bar. Suspicious, you type in 'ABIS PLUS' and hit enter. An ad comes up.

"Are you tired of standing out in the big crowd? Feel like no matter what, you can't put on an ounce? Do all your friends call you 'beanpole', 'the skinny one', and 'lightweight'? In Zaftig city, bigger is better, and nothing helps you more then ABIS PLUS. For a limited time, get a free bar, and see for yourself the awesome results you get, our special metabolism lowering, fat storing formula will ensure that no matter what you eat, you'll be packing on pound faster then a hippo at an all you can eat buffet."

Following it is a fast paced disclaimer, you don't catch it all, but you hear the usual 'eat responsibly' and 'not responsibly for unintended' and 'consult your doctor if'. What hit's home though is 'Formula may be compounded by additional Abis products, use caution when combining." You swallow a knot in your throat, wondering what you ate. Exactly how long is this stuff supposed to last? Can you do anything about it?
132132122.title: You wake up, and something is off...

choices: Right
Wrong
1321321222.content:
Whatever this is, it’s got to wear off soon enough. You know what is causing it, and it’s a product they want to sell, so it can’t last all that long. After a couple of days, it’ll wear off and you can lose the weight like normal. So you go to bed, feeling a little better about the situation.

The next day you wake up, and check the mirror. As you expected, you’re looking a bit bigger. By now it’s safe to say your plump, there can be no doubt. Your glad you got some bigger clothing, as there is no way your original cloths would fit now without the fabric tearing, or your shirt riding up. Even so your new cloths are not loose either, and your not sure exactly how long it’ll take for your gain to slow down. But you skip breakfast, figuring if the chemicals work by increasing fat storing, you’ll just cut off the source until you are back to normal.

You get to work and change into uniform. “Hey, are you bulking up?” asks Lionard, noticing your uniform looking snug on you. “Not that I’m judging or anything,” he says putting a paw on his stomach and shaking it to emphasize, “But you may want to switch to a larger size.” You nod in agreement, and pull out one of the larger size uniforms.

You go about your day as usual, but your stomach grumbles. Skipping breakfast has left you hungry, but you know it’s necessary to keep your weight gain to a minimum. By lunch though, you feel faint, and gladly take the slice of pizza offered to you by Lionard without complaint.

As you approach the end of your shift, you yawn a little, then notice you dropped a coin on the floor. You bend over to pick it up. Suddenly there is a ‘RIIIIIIIIIP’, as your pants tear along the backside. Embarrassed, you quickly retreat to the back, huffing and puffing. You look at yourself in the mirror, just in time for the bottom two shirt buttons to pop off, followed by a snap as the pants button give out as your stomach rolls out over it. You are defiantly fat at this point having ballooned a good three inches at least since this morning. You’ve developed love handles, and your chin is starting to produce a double, with rounded cheeks starting to frame your face and muzzle. You are shocked, did just the pizza at lunch do this? No that didn’t make sense… wait, you think about what happens when you skip meals, suddenly realizing that not eating can actually make you store fat more easily since your body thinks your starving. Did you make things worse? Hurriedly you change into the next size up, managing to hide the torn uniform in your locket just before Lionard, comes in.

“Everything alright…” he says looking you over, looking a little puzzled. “You should probably lay off the pizza, you look a bit… bloated. Anyway good job today. You’ve really saved my business.”

“Um… sure, no problem,” you say, hoping he didn’t decide to check in your locker. You can’t believe you outgrew the uniform after you had already sized up. “I’ll see you tomorrow,” you say hurrying towards the door. “Wait up,” says Lionard, handing you a pizza box. “I know I just said to lay off, but, I know how difficult it is to stay thin in this city, so maybe I’m being too unreasonable, I don’t want to scare you off or anything.” You then realize your expression of worry could be interpreted as fear, and Lio may be thinking your scared of him. “In fact,” he says, stacking another two boxes in your hands, “Help yourself, it’s the least I can do, and it’s not like you're the only big guy here.”

“No really, it’s fine,” you say, but end up taking the pizza anyway, too distracted by your sudden growth to argue all that much. Your trying to figure out what to do, obviously ‘fasting’ made things worse, so you need to eat regular meals. You change into your regular clothes, which by now won’t fit over your ballooning body, you can barely get your shirt halfway past your gut, and the only thing keeping your pants, too small to button, from falling down is the belt which is now at it’s last hole. But now your getting so fat that you are starting to feel the weight, as you waddle out the door and down the street, huffing with each step. Your stomach growls as the new ‘work out’ burns your energy. You collapse onto a bench, breathing heavily. Well, you have food, and you need to eat. So you open a box and have a few slices before grunting and getting back up. You head to the clothing store, buying even more clothes, baggy ones this time, before finally giving in and calling down a taxi to drive you to the hotel. When you finally get to your room, you collapse on the couch, the unaccustomed weight exhausting you. Your stomach growls again, and you feed it with more pizza, several boxes now in the room from the last three days, with plenty to spare.

Before you settle for bed, you check the mirror once more. A double chin has formed, your arms look thicker, wobbling as you lift them. Your chest has swelled, resting on top your belly, which hangs down to the top of your legs. You lift it in your hands, feeling it squish in-between. Your thighs look bigger too, and you can feel your rump has swollen out as well. It’s been a couple of days since you had those bars, so this should settle down tomorrow, right?

You push yourself up slowly, not used to the feeling of shifting gravity as your flab shifts it’s position as you manage to get yourself to your feet. you begin making your way to the bathroom, huffing and puffing before you finally lay eyes on the full scope of the damage.

Swollen cheeks merge with the tire of flab of your non-existent neck, chins resting between two hills of fur that form your chest that prop up two arms that sag with gravity, but dwarfed by the huge belly that hangs almost to your knees, your legs hugely swollen and rub together as you attempt to carry yourself. You are a blimp of a fox, barely even able to reach over your stomach to reach the faucet and splash water in your face.

You only just got this job, if you go absent you may risk losing it. And gym memberships cost money as well. And your SURE that the gaining has to stop soon, it can’t possibly be much longer. You think. You mentally reassure yourself that you can make it through this, even if you probably resemble a giant donut more then a fox. The thought makes your stomach grumble, and you realize that you haven’t eaten, and go for the pizza boxes, finding yourself even hungrier today then yesterday, going so far as to finish everything you have left. Still, you manage to fill your stomach before lumbering through the door… which is starting to feel a little claustrophobia inducing.

The door opens and someone almost runs into you as they exit, as you block a good portion of the door. Embarrassed you step to the side trying to suck in your gut as they sidle by. You ride the elevator down and catch a taxi, knowing you’ll never make it if you attempt to walk to the restaurant.

You manage to get to your job on time, but as you walk through the door, feel a sudden tug at your hips. You look down to see them wedged in the door. “Wow… you really let yourself go.” says the Lion as he spots you struggling to push yourself through, popping free within a few seconds, but red… redder in the face. “You were like…. skinny when I hired you three days ago, right?” he questions as he walks over and examines your new physique, as if doubting his memory. “I’m hoping it stops soon,” you say truthfully, wondering if this would get you in trouble.

“Well, it’s not like I’m complaining… nice not to be the biggest guy working here.” says the lion, as you realize that you’re now wider then he is.

“Uh… yeah,” you said, waddling back towards the staff room, getting an even bigger uniform then yesterday.

Today is even busier then yesterday, with you behind the counter, business have improved greatly, with patrons much more at ease, you catch scant comments about you, how friendly you look compared to the last guy. You can’t help but feel a little guilty. You try to focus on your work, your size is making the area behind the counter feel much more cramped, and you have difficulty with the register as it tends to get slammed shut against your gut before you have put the customers money in, or before you’ve gotten change. And your uniform feels tight, you’re at the largest size the Lion has, and it’s tight around the middle.

By lunch, you’re legs are burning from standing for so long, your feet are sore, and you go to the break room for lunch. A pizza box is on the table, the Lion figuring that a slice just wasn’t going to cut it for you today. You go for a seat and sit….

The sound of bending metal hits your ear as soon as you let your weight down, your rump spilling over the sides, and the chair collapses under you. You fall to the ground, and feel your body deform like a water balloon as it hit the ground. the front button of your shirt pops off on impact, before you fall back, your stomach sloshing on top of you.

“Wow, you ok?” asks the Lion as he rushes in to check on the commotion.

“Yeah… heh…” you gasp, as you slowly roll off the ruined chair, “Just…. pant…. an accident.”

“Yeah…. you should probably…. not demolish the furniture.” he says, looking somewhat annoyed at the destruction of property. “Be more careful in future.”

You nod, out of breath, then help clear away the broken chair. You get two more, and carefully position one under each of your sore butt cheeks to distribute the weight more evenly. You never though you would get so big that you take up as much space as two people. And your stomach pokes out of the hole in the front of your shirt as you grab for the pizza, easily devouring the whole thing in your embarrassment and increased appetite before reminding yourself that your supposed to be avoiding gaining any more weight.

By the end of the day, you feel embarrasses as you struggle to get your regular clothes on, feeling like your limbs are sausages you’re trying to stuff into soda straws. You barely manage, but find your shirt has ridden up on your stomach, and can feel the lions eyes on you as you waddle out. You feel like your face couldn’t get any redder as you wobble with each step, and can feel the floor shaking under your tonnage. You move through the door, and feel your self wedge in-between like this morning, and push to free yourself…

Only this time, you don’t budge.

You push as hard as you can, at first feeling the frame slide against your fur and clothes, but then suddenly you stop, stuck halfway through. You try to back up, to maybe come at it at a different angle, but your flab bunches up the other way, and you find yourself unable to back out. You push forward with your hands on the frame, while pushing against the floor, but your muscles aren’t strong enough to free yourself.

After struggling, you give up, “Help!” you yell, hoping that the Lion is still around. You hear footstep behind you before you hear the Lion behind you say "Sure…
