132132122222.content:
At this point you feel like you don't have a choice, at the rate your ballooning, you're going to be bedridden by tomorrow. Heck, at the rate you've been growing you'll probably be too fat to fit through the door by lunch. You reluctantly give your boss a call, getting his voicemail and leaving a message that your "condition" has flared up and you need to take care of it. Then, with nothing else ready to eat, you down a few slices of pizza, convincing yourself that you just need it for fuels and to keep you from entering starvation mode before waddling out the door which is looking particularly confining today. You begin heading to the elevator, then stop, realizing that the situation demands that every chance you have at this point must be made with losing weight in mind, and the elevator... well, not exactly the best way to burn calories. So instead you look for the stairs.

You'd think going down the stairs wouldn't be so difficult, but you've never tried descending stairs with a pudding filled beanbag stuffed under your shirt. You have to grip the railing hard, unable to see around your bulk to where your feet are landing, and feeling your weight shift which each step, each decent like a sudden wave as you body wobbles, threatening your sense of balance as you try to keep yourself toppling forward as your belly pulls you down before bouncing back, your weight shifting to the rear to make you almost sit back. You don't dare sit down in case you can't get back up, or start rolling. All the while your huffing and sweating, your grip feeling slippery, and your heart pounding at the real fear that your legs could give out and send you careening down the stairwell.

What feels like an eternity later, you finally reach the 1st floor and waddle out, feeling some small sense of relief for that ordeal to be over, wobbling on shaky legs out the front of the building, trying to start a jog but devolves quickly into a 'power waddle' as you exert yourself, pumping your arms, which sag and bounce like their own individual jello molds, though nothing compared to the massive sacks of flesh decorating the rest of your body. You feel red with embarrassment as you pass by others on the street, wondering what they were thinking about the red water balloon currently bouncing down the street, pulling down on your shirt as it starts riding up from the motion of you heaving your bulk. Finally, you stop, out of breath, and look to see how far you've gone... about a hundred feet from the building. Wheezing in disbelief, you gulp and swallow down hard, feeling your cheeks wobble with the action, before pressing on again. You can't afford to get discouraged, if you give up, you may as well say goodbye to walking at all. Or standing.

You force yourself along one step at a time, swearing that each step feels harder then the last. It very well may be, your probably getting even fatter with whatever metabolism slowing cocktail still running through your system, as you hear your belt creaking against the weight of your stomach. Pulling your shirt down for the umpteenth time, you swear more and more of your stomach rolls are showing. Still, with no other course of action, you plop onward, until you find yourself in another part of the city, drenched in sweat and looking at the first gym you’ve come across. A sigh above the door reads “Husky’s Gym’. You would laugh at that if you weren’t so out of breath. You push through the double doors, thankful that the wide entrance is available.

You see a number of slim and muscular individuals working out on the machines. It looks like a typical gym, and you feel embarrassed looking down at your blob-like features. You don’t see anyone at the counter, so you decide you’ll just get started and sort out the details of a membership whenever they come back. You look at the machines, groaning a little at the treadmills, which you’ve decided you’ve done enough of that just getting here. Maybe some weight lifting. You look at an empty pull down machine, and head towards it, adjusting the knee brace to it’s widest, setting much to your chagrin, before trying to climb into the seat.

“Hey, hey hey! What are you doing!” a voice says, just before you can lower your rump into the much smaller seat. You look around to see, surprise to no one, a husky coming from the front. Husky is the right word, though defiantly a weight lifter, his arms are jacked, but sports a round stomach. “Um, just trying to work out?” you say “I intend to join.” The Husky snorts and pushes you off the machine with surprising ease, “Not that, this is is the lightweight room, the machines aren’t built for your physique, you want the pachyderm room in back! You’re about to snap that seat in two!” You feel embarrassed now being confirmed to be comparable to a hippo in stature. “Seriously, you’ve got to be a newbie, everyone else knows that you have to work out by weight class around here. And you are definitely no lightweight.” he pokes you in the stomach, finger sinking in like the worlds biggest stress ball. You hear another creak as he does, and your belt finally snaps, the pressure the straw that broke the camels back, the sound like a gun shot as the buckle flies off, ricocheting against a few machines before the Husky catches it in one hand. “Geez, you overdose on those gaining bars or something?” he says, looking at the belt buckle in disbelief. “Maybe? You say, surprised that the guy would easily guess something like that. “Yeah, serious newbie move.” he says, tossing the buckle into a bin across the room. “Ok, let’s get you fixed up blubber ball, I’m not rolling you home or anything.” He walks to a door in the back, and you follow. trying not to let your shorts fall down while trying to reach around your massive frame.

In the back you seem much large equipment, and appropriately, bigger species. A few elephants lift barbells that are probably bigger then you, which is saying something. But the Husky leads to to a bar, picking out what looks like a shake mix, tosses it into a blender with some ice, and makes a shake, pouring into a cup before sliding it to you. “Here, you’ll need this” he says.

“What is it?” you ask, not sure about drinking another weight themed product.

“Extra strength protein builder.” he says, “Usually I’d say work it off, but that won’t do any good if you max out and can’t move in the next few hours, don’t know how long you’ve been on the stuff, so I’ll make an exception if your up for it. Or you can just do it the old fashion way, and maybe you’ll be fine. Your choice.”

Great…

"....No, not really." you say, shaking my head. "Was it that obvious as well?"

"Well, yes, seeing as you're---" She gestures her hand at your body, unmistakably slender underneath all the oversized clothing, and then gestures back to hers, with her round stomach and large breasts.

"Ahh."

"....Tell you what" she says. "I'll agree to purchase those clothes for you, IF......"

"If what?"

"You agree to home home with me for the night." she says, smiling at you. "What do you say?"

You're still out of money and you still have absolutely no idea where you are. You know exactly what to say.

....After the tigress purchases all her belongings and your new set of clothes, she leads you out into the parking lot to a red convertible the size of a SUV, clearly designed for people of a much larger size than you're used to.

After the tigress drives out of the parking lot out onto the streets, filled with all manner of vehicles filled with all manner of creatures of all manners of size, she asks you a little bit about yourself and why you're here. With your memory as fuzzy as it is, you can only tell her so much, and you eventually end up having to admit as such to her....which, remarkably enough, she takes in stride.

"Thank you very much for this." you eventually say a little while later. "It's so generous of you to do this for me."

"Think nothing of it!" she says. "Generosity is the very foundation of this city! All we have been able to accomplish has been because of that sot of kindness and altruism."

"Really."

"Really!" she says. "We care about one another here, and are always more than happy to help one another out. Trust me on this."

Seeing how damn big and advanced this place is, you are actually inclined to do so.

After the two of you dive for some time, you finally stop in a large elegant neighborhood, and the tigress finally parks in front of a large red house.

"Welcome home." she says, getting out of the car, grabbing her bags as she goes.

"Now, then.....
13222.title: The Curvy Tigress

choices: Accept Devon's lunch offer
Decline Devon's luck offer
13223.content:
Neither of these furs seem like charitable souls. Both seem too engrossed with their shopping to share a minute, let alone money, on a naked fox.

Hiding behind a clothing rack, you continue to scope out any other customer who might give you a hand. As your gaze turns towards the back of the store near the fitting rooms, you see the head of a orange kangaroo with chubby cheeks and a thick neck roll of fat peak out from curtain leading to the rooms. He's frantically looking around the store for someone. You and the 'roo make eye contact, and he mouths the words "Help!" as he gestures you to the fitting rooms before disappearing behind the curtain again.

Curious, you sneak your way to the back of the shop and slip behind the curtain which leads to a hall of stalls for patrons to try on their clothes. The 'roo is nowhere to be seen.

"H-hello?" you ask out loud.

"Over here!" said a voice. A pudgy hand with sausage-like fingers opens up the door to a stall at the end of the hallway.

Walking into the stall, you see the kangaroo that beckoned you. He seems to take up most of the space in the stall. Easily over five hundred pounds, the 'roo is naked from the waist up. A hefty moobs sit on his sizable cream-colored belly. But from the waist down, the guy was gigantic even for Zaftig City standards. Each thigh was so big you were unsure you unsure you could wrap your arms around just one of them. His tail was just as plump; you never thought a tail could get as fat as his. But the 'roo's rump was absolutely massive. It was as if someone had stuck a pair of beach balls filled with pudding onto the beside of a moderately chubby 'roo. Yet his bottom half was covered up by a pair of suit pants that looked skin-tight on him even though they were unbuttoned and unzipped. The poor guy might as well have been stuffed into a sausage casing.

"I need your help!" the 'roo said.

"Okay...with what?"

"I need to get this off of me!" he said while gesturing towards the pants he was currently stuffed into. "Preferably without destroying them! The manager will be furious with me if he sees that I ripped apart another pair of pants!"

"Uh, alright," you say. "How exactly can I help you?"

"I have an idea," he said. The 'roo used both hands pressed against his lovehandles which were flowing over the top of his pants. "See if you can pull them down, if even just a little bit!" You position yourself behind the orange kangaroo. Grabbing both sides of the pants, you are able to shimmy them down a couple of inches.

"Great!" said the 'roo. "Let's keep going!" Using both hands, he pressed against the flab on his right flank enough for you to pull down the pants another inch or two. The same process is repeated on the left side. After a couple of minutes, you get the pants down to the point where you can start seeing his buttcrack. Squeezing the right upper part of his buttock, you yank down his pants a couple of inches and the 'roo lets go to work on the left side letting soft doughy fat spill over the top of his pants. Inch by inch, more of the 'roo's gigantic butt is freed. Seeing his rump released from the confines of those pants was like watching a marshmallow expand in the microwave, and you wonder how he was able to stuff himself inside these in the first place.

After ten more minutes of hard work, the 'roo's rump is free. You hear the kangaroo sigh in relief as you marvel at the two massive jiggly orange globes in front of you. Perfectly round, not a trace of cellulite on them, and they looked as if they were soft as a cloud. You have to resist the urge to reach out and see just how far your paw will sink into one of those plump orbs.

The rest of the task is simple by comparison, and soon the 'roo's bottom half is just as bare as your's.

"Ah, man. Thanks a million. Seriously, I couldn't have gotten these things off without your help." said the kangaroo.

"No problem," you said. "I was amazed you could get those on you by yourself in the first place.

"Well, I really wanted to make them fit," said the 'roo. "They were the biggest size the store carried, and I need some dress pants for a formal work occasion soon and I didn't want to have to order them online or anything like that."

"Really? They don't carry your size?" you ask.

"Not in pants," he replies. "Shirts are fine, but they don't carry the size of pants I need because...well..." He gestured to his humongous butt. "I'm a bit thicker in some areas. I'm Devon, by the way."

You two shake paws. "Nice to meet you. Hey, Devon, can I ask you a favor?"

"Sure! I owe you one anyways."

"Cool. Umm, I need some clothes. Don't ask why. Is there any chance you can get me something to wear from here?"

"Of course, no problem!" said Devon. "I was going to ask why you weren't wearing anything when you came in, but I guessed that I shouldn't look a gift horse in the mouth. Speaking of which, I better cover this back up with I'm going to buy you something to wear," he said while patting his rump.

"Well, I've pretty much already seen everything, but I guess not everyone is keen to see a big ol' 'roo butt," you say jokingly. Devon puts back on his stretchy red basketball shorts that cling to him tightly and a tank top that just covers his belly. He squeezes past you and waddles back onto the sales floor as you watch his huge ass wobble and shake with every step.

After ten minutes of waiting in the fitting room, Devon comes back with a shopping back in tow. "Here, they're the smallest sizes I could find. And they're not exactly fashionable."

You open up the bag to fit a white shirt and blue jeans. "No worries," you said. "I'm more concerned with just covering up." The white shirt hangs loosely off of you, and the jeans are far too large for you. Luckily, Devon was considerate enough to get you a belt for them as well.

"Lucky skinny fox, able to get clothes that fit him!" Devon joked.

You stick your tongue out at him. "Sorry that I don't pack as much in the butt department as you do." you reply.

"Speaking of which, do you want to get something to eat? My treat. It looks like you've been starved for months anyways."
13223.title: A 'roo in need

choices: "Yeah, bring it on!"
"Nah, I think I'd be sick..."
132231.content:
Twenty minutes later, you find yourself sitting at a table in a nearby chain Mexican food joint waiting for Devon. He volunteered to ordered and, since it was his treat to you, you let him go. Being late in the afternoon, the place was pretty quiet; you and Devon are the only two patrons. You gaze out a nearby window while you wait on the 'roo.

The sound of a heavily laden plastic tray slamming down on your table startles you. Dozens and dozens of foil-wrapped burritos are carefully piled on top of it. Your mouth waters as you can smell the seasoned beef through the wrappers.

"They're pretty quick today!" said Devon as he drags over another chair from an empty table nearby. He carefully positions the two chairs before plopping down to sit, each cheek of Devon's expansive butt practically engulfing its respective chair. "Dig in!"

You grab a burrito, unwrap it from its foil, and take a large bite. Perfectly seasoned, just the right amount of cheese, a great blend of beans, the burrito was simply amazing. A few more eager bites and it's gone. You reach for another and swallow that one just as fast. Then another and another.

Devon is helping take on the mountain of burritos. A quick glance over and you see the 'roo has a burrito in each hand, alternating bites. He's easily able to eat the things twice as fast as you.

A mere ten minutes later and that pile of burritos is no more. You lost count of how many you had after ten; Devon didn't seem to bother counter at all. The table is covered in discarded foil wrappers.

You sigh in relief, feeling a tad uncomfortably full but nevertheless satisfied and glad you got a decent meal in you. You give the distinct curve of your stuffed belly a rub with your paw to sooth it.

Devon, too, is rubbing his gut, a paw under his tank top caressing the dome of his gut. "That was pretty good. Ready for Round 2?"

"Round 2? You mean more?"

"Yeah, of course." said Devon. "I can easily eat what we just ate on my own. I do it pretty often actually. I guess that's why our order came up pretty quick. They must have seen me coming and got all hands on deck. So what do you say, foxy? Think you can handle some more?"
132231.title: Burritos for days

choices: "I want you to be my personal servant for a week!"
I want to take you to a buffet! Fill you up until you're ready to pop!"
1322311.content:
You thought to yourself for a few moments if your belly could handle eating any more. A paw lazily rubbed your swollen gut.

"Well, what do you say, foxy?" asked Devon.

Deep inside, you felt churning. Looking directly into Devon's eye, you let out a long, low, rumbling blech, and felt significantly less bloated. "Yeah, bring it on!" you said to the 'roo.

He smirked back at you. "Alright. Look's like we got a cocky fox here, then..." The massive roo once again got up and made his way to the front counter. As you waited for him, you continued rubbing your belly, making sure to create some room for whatever he brings back.

Ten minutes later, the 'roo waddled back to your table and slammed down a tray with two dozen tacos in front on you. "I want to make things interesting." said Devon. "I don't think a skinny fox like you could eat all of those tacos."

You cocked an eyebrow. "Wanna bet?"

"That's exactly what I want to," Devon said as he grinned. "I bet that you can't eat all of those tacos."

"And what do you want if I lose?" you asked. "I won't lose. But I'd like to here what you would have wanted."

Devon chuckled a little. "Let me think...You know what I haven't had in a good, long while? A full-body massage. Lots of masseurs won't serve me here. The last guy I hired complained that half my rump took up the entire session time. So if, or rather when, you lose, we head back over to my place and see what foxy's magic paws can do."

You stuck out your tongue at Devon. "You make it sound like a bad thing to lose then."

"You say that now, but you'll be sorry when it's Hour 4 and you are hardly halfway done since there's a lot of me to rub down."

"Don't get too ahead of yourself," you replied. "I haven't started yet but I'm hungry for tacos!"

The 'roo leaned in. "And if you win, though you won't, what do you want?"

You thought for a moment before settle on your wager. "If I win, I want....I want..."
1322311.title: The Challenge

choices: Take a bite. Just one...
Will yourself from eating any more
1322312.content:
"Nah, I think I'd be sick..." you say. It's mostly true. Sure, you might be able to handle a little more, but feel like you're close to your absolute limit.

"Alright, suit yourself," said Devon as he pushed himself away from the table. The two chairs supporting his girth screeched against the floor. "I'm getting some more then. I had a light breakfast after all," he said getting onto his feet.

"Did you now?" you ask.

"Yeah, I only had time to eat a half dozen doughnuts this morning. Serves me right for oversleeping, I guess. Better not do that again. Breakfast is the most important meal, after all." Devon gave you a wink as he waddled back to the front counter of the restaurant.

"Looks like every meal is the most important meal for you," you say under your breath as you look over your shoulder and watch Devon's well-padded haunches jiggle and wobble away.

Being a courteous guest, you decide to clean off the table while you wait for Devon to return. You crumple up the foil wrappers littering your table onto the tray and walk it over to one of the garbage cans. As you dump your trash, you notice your paws are stained with sauce. So, you head over to the bathroom and wash up. Before you leave, you lift up your shirt to see the damage lunch has done to you. Your white-furred stomach, once flat, now is considerably convex, no doubt because of how bloated you are on burritos. It's nothing compared to Devon, let alone many of the big-bellied furs you've seen in this city. But you figure you'll deflate back down once lunch is digested. You give your stuffed midsection a quick rub before pulling down your shirt and exiting the bathroom.

When you come back to your table, Devon has already returned with the second half of his lunch. Quesadillas are stacked one atop another on a tray, each filled with gooey cheese and various meat like pork and chicken and steak. As you sit back down, Devon is taking an entire quesadilla, folding it in half, and devoring it like a slice of pizza.

You watch in awe as the heavy kangaroo sucks down quesadilla after quesadilla. Your silent stares catch Devon's attention, and he coyly smiles.

"Mmm....God, these are so good!" he says melodramatically. "Ah, absolutely delicious!" He takes a massive bite out of the quesadilla he's holding and slowly chews it, occasionally giving off an exaggerated moan of pleasure. More bites, more moans, and the quesadilla is gone.

Devon picks up another one off the tray. "Steak! These are my favorite! They smell so delicious." He holds a steaming quesadilla up to your nose. "Doesn't it smell great?"

You take a whiff and the 'roo was right. That smell alone got your mouth watering.

Devon quickly pulled the quesadilla away and chowed it down in a few bites. His already rounded cheeks bludged out considerably as he chewed in bliss.

"You're really missing out, foxy!" he said after swallowing. "But I get it, skiny guys like you can only eat so little." He grabbed another from the pile in front on him. "Too bad. More for me then." He gave you another wink before folding that quesadilla in half a biting deeply into it.

As you watch Devon eat and eat, he continues to tease you. While your stomach is telling you that you're really full, your brain is making you want even more food.

Devon sees the conflict in your face and decides to strike. He hold up another quesadilla to your muzzle, chicken, this time. A devious smile is on his face. "Don't you want a bite? Just one? Just a taste?"
1322312.title: Lunch Part II

choices: Agree to be the Devon's roommate
Politely decline his offer
13223121.content:
"A bite won't hurt...it does look really good after all..." you say.

Devon smirked. "Go ahead, foxy. Just one bite..." His meaty hand waved the quesadilla an inch from your mouth.

Seduced by the allure of gooey cheese and greasy meat, you tilt your head forward and open your mouth wide. Before you can bite, the 'roo shoves as much of the quesadilla into your mouth as he can. This catches you off guard. Yet to your surprise, you don't find yourself gagging or spitting it out. Rather, you find yourself mechanically chewing it up. The 'roo continued pushing the quesadilla into your eager mouth. Your body filled with a mixture of lust and excitement that peaked when you felt Devon's thick paw against your muzzle, forcing the last bit into you.

"I guess you're right," said Devon as he watched you struggle to chew all that food. "Just one bite wouldn't hurt!" You try shooting him a look though it's hard for you to do with your comically full cheek bludging out.

After a minute or so, you managed to swallow down the last little bit, adding more pressure into your already packed gut. Rubbing your distended belly, you give out a slight moan of pain.

"Next time, warn me before you try to choke me with a quesadilla," you said.

"But the surprise made it so much fun!" replied Devon. "Besides, it didn't look like you hated it very much." That was true. It felt slightly thrilling, the feeling of being made to eat, the idea that a grossly overweight fur is stuffing grease and fat into your maw, being unconformably full yet forced to devour more. You feel the rush of blood to your cheeks and try to change the conversation.

"Yeah, well, at least I can handle all that," you retorted. "I haven't seen you do the same."

Devon nonchalantly reached over to over of the last quesadillas on the tray. He expertly folded it, folded it once more, and shoved the entire thing into his greedy mouth. A few seconds of chewing later and he swallowed the mass.

"What was that you were saying?" Devon asked coyly.

"My bad, I should have guess you could do that," you jested.

"Practice makes perfect," said Devon.

"Then I guess I should practice more," you said back to Devon while smiling.

"Then I guess we should do this again sometime," Devon suggested. He raised him arms up to stretch, causing his tank top is rise up exposing a couple of inches of his furry belly. "I gotta get home so I can nap this off." The 'roo gave his bloated stomach a light tap.

"A nap sounds so good right now," you said. "Maybe I can find a park bench or somewhere to lay down."

"What do you mean by that?" the kangaroo asks. You go to explain how you ended up in this city. Waking up naked in the park, with memory of what happened to you, no money, no clothes, and no place to stay.

"Wow, that's bizarre." Devon says. "If you need a place to stay, I got an open room in my apartment. My roommate moved out last month and I haven't found anyone who wants it. He even left some things like his old bed and a dresser, so you won't need to go out and buy those. I won't make you pay for rent at first; I don't need it that bad. It'll give you a place to live while you get on your feet. What do you think?"
13223121.title: Tricked by Devon.

choices: Politely decline dessert
Go back to Devon's place for dessert
13223122.content:
Although that quesadilla does look delicious, you managed to will yourself from indulging any further. You're already uncomfortably full, and you wouldn't want a bellyache to ruin what would be otherwise a fine meal.

"Thanks, but I'll pass," you said to Devon, pushing the quesadilla back to him.

The 'roo shrugged his shoulders. "Eh, suit yourself." He folded the quesadilla in half and chopped it down in a few bites. "More for me, then!" Devon said after swallowing.

"That doesn't bother me," you replied as you continued watching Devon work through all the food. In only minutes, another tray was emptied. The 'roo smiled in satisfaction as one of his greasy paws slipped under his tank top and started gently massaging his stuffed belly. Again, to be courteous, you cleaned up the table and returned the tray while the orange kangaroo groaning slightly while digesting his meal.

"Are you doing alright?" you asked the 'roo. "I hope you didn't overeat or anything."

"Nah, I'm fine." replied Devon. "I've eaten way more before. I probably just ate a bit too quickly. I tend to eat really fast when I try to impress a guy." The 'roo gave you a wink, and you blushed slightly.

"Well, you certainly did impress me," you said. "I just wished you didn't have to impress me in a way that gave you indigestion or something."

"Again, I think I'll be fine," Devon assured you. "Especially when I get home. Ice cream always soothes my stomach and I have a ton of it."

"Somehow, that does not surprise me..." you said teasing the 'roo. He stuck his tongue out at you.

"Yeah, but would enough ice cream to fill full an entire freezer surprise you?"

"An entire freezer? How did you end up with so much? Got a sweet tooth on a shopping spree or something?"

"Not quite," began Devon. "A friend of mine works in management for one of the grocery chains in town. He gave me a hot tip that one of the stores nearby me was shutting down completely for renovations. They're gutting the store, so they need to get rid of everything absolutely everything. I found out what day they were going to slash prices and made sure I was the first fur there when they opened in the morning."

"Wow, guess it pays to have friends in high places." you said.

"Oh yeah, it does!" the 'roo said enthusiastically. "Say, do you want to come over for dessert? Ice cream, specifically?"

While you are still a bit full from your meal, a bowl of ice cream does sound nice. And you'll probably have room in your stomach by the time you reach Devon's place. On the other hand, it seems like you have spent most of the day with this 'roo, and there is so much for you to do. You need money, some place to stay, and (hopefully) answers as to why you ended up here in the first place.
13223122.title: Eat to live, not live to eat

choices: You wake up the following morning
You wake up in the middle of the night
132231222.content:
An hour later and you're sat down on a couch in Devon's living room. Mounted to the wall across from you is easily the largest television screen you have ever seen. Remote in hand, you flipped through the channels searching for anything interesting. You landed on "Watchin' 'em Go!" which appeared to be some kind of dance-themed reality show.

Looking over to your right, you saw two considerable dents in the couch cushions that were sunk a couple of inches lower than the cushion you were sat upon. "Probably Devon's spot..." you thought to yourself. Each indentation looked roughly the size of a particular rotunded 'roo's buttcheek.

"What kind of ice cream do you want?" Devon yelled from the kitchen.

"Umm, what kind do you have?" you asked.

"Lots! Just name a flavor, I probably have it."

You thought to yourself for a moment and decided to just go for a classic. "Strawberry!" you yelled back. A few minutes later, Devon waddled out of the kitchen with a carton of ice cream in one paw and a spoon in the other. His vast, cream-colored belly shimmied and wobble as the overfed kangaroo lumbered through his apartment.

Devon had stripped off his stretchy shorts and tank top the moment he walked back into his home, tossing them onto the living room floor. "Just making myself at home! Besides, it's nothing you haven't seen already." It was true. After all, it was only hours ago that your face was inches away from his globular rump in that changing room. "Feel free to make yourself at home, too." That why your outfit laid on the floor next to Devon's.

"Here you go!" said the 'roo. You took the carton of ice cream and spoon from his, and he turned around to get some ice cream for himself. You admired his spherical, hefty butt and plump tail as he plodded away. When he invited you over, you were thinking you'd just have a bowl or two of ice cream but not an entire carton. Upon further reflection, you realized that was a silly idea. A fur the size of Devon probably stopped bothering with bowls a couple of hundred pounds ago. Tearing open the carton, you began eating the treat while watching the TV.

The 'roo returned to the living room a couple of minutes later with a carton of ice cream of his own. Positioning himself just right, the fur lowered his weight right into the butt-shaped indent in the couch. Devon open his carton of ice cream and started wolfing it down. You glanced over to see what flavor he picked: Chocolate Catastrophe.

By the time you're a third of the way through the carton, you started feeling full again. Devon, on the other hand, was just about finished with his. He was scraping his spoon against the walls of the container getting any and all of the remained ice cream. When the spoon was no longer helpful, he lifted the carton to his muzzle. The liquid remains of the ice cream dripped into his mouth although a couple of drops landed on his flabby chest.

With a sigh of pleasure, the 'roo tossed the empty carton and spoon onto the coffee table. He looked over and noticed you were no longer eating.

"Is there something wrong with the ice cream?" he asked.

"Nah, it's actually really good. I'm just getting full again. I guess I'm not used to eating an entire carton of ice cream!" you joked.

"And you won't if you quit halfway through!" said Devon.

"I'm not quitting! I'm just...taking a break."

"Yeah right, skinny," teased Devon. "Just admit your tiny tummy can't handle a little ice cream..."

"Yes, it can! Some of us just can't inhale ice cream like you can!"

"Excuses, excuses..." The 'roo continued to taunt you as he heaved himself off of the couch. "You know what? I think I'll go for seconds! Gosh, I can fit so much delicious ice cream in my belly!" He gave his vast gut a slap before waddling back into the kitchen.

When Devon came back several minutes later, he brought with him a carton of birthday cake flavored ice cream and another clean spoon. He was greeted by the sight of you digging back into your ice cream, struggling to get more and more of the strawberry treat into your already distended belly. The 'roo smirked to himself as he sat back down on the couch.

"I forgot to tell you that I'm a bit of a bad influence," he said as he stuck his spoon into the carton. You ignored him as you just wanted to focus on showing him up.

Around fifteen minutes later, your carton of ice cream was finished. Tossing the empty carton onto the coffee table, you leaned back into the couch, your paw rubbing your incredibly swollen belly. Your once-flat abdomen now looked like a red furry basketball. Devon finished his second carton shortly after you. He, too, tossed his empty carton on the table and gave his enormous belly a pat.

The 'roo looked over and admired your bloated state. "Hey foxy, I guess you can eat an entire carton of ice cream!" said Devon. You said nothing back but rather gave a moan of pain. The 'roo grabbed the television remote and changed the channel. "Let me have that. I think Channel 77 is playing Knives of Justice 2!"

You were far too tired to watch the movie, and a couple of minutes in, you closed your eyes and fell asleep with your paws resting on your balloon-like belly.
132231222.title: Dessert with Devon

choices: Go back to sleep
Check in on Devon
1322312222.content:
The glow of the television was the only source of light in the living room when you woke up several hours later. Playing is a movie that you don't recognize. Your paws are still resting on your belly. It has deflated a bit. A layer of pliable softness had developed. You gave the new roll of fat a poke and watched your midsection jiggle slightly.

Looking over to your right, you saw that Devon wasn't there. You placed a paw on one of the indents in the sofa caused by the massive 'roo's weight. The couch was still slightly warm; he must have gotten up recently.

Then you heard grunts and groans. You looked over your shoulder and down the hallway of the apartment. At the end of the hall, a door was open ajar and a slice of light poured into the hallway. You guessed it was the kangaroo's bedroom. Another grunt and groan echoed down the hallway.

Is Devon in trouble? Does he need your help? If he needed your help, then he probably would have yelled for you.
1322312222.title: One post-ice cream nap later...

choices: Give it a try
Decline
13223122222.content:
You hoisted yourself off the couch and quietly walked down the hallway, noticing the occasional ripple of your chunkier abdomen. Step by step, you made it closer to Devon's bedroom. As you got closer, you heard a quite hissing noise followed by an obvious grunt of pain. Inches away from the door to the bedroom, you peaked your head forward and looked in from the slightly opened door.

A look of agony was on the kangaroo's face joined by an occasional aching wince. The source of Devon's pain was obvious. His belly, loose and flabby hours ago, was now entirely spherical and looked tight as a drum. It appeared like Devon had devoured half of a grocery store, or ate a feast meant for half a dozen furs, or as if he consumed his entire freezer of ice cream.

"Oh my God, Devon blew up like a balloon," you thought to yourself.

You didn't realize how accurate that statement was. In front of the massively bloated 'roo was a large bicycle pump; its plunger was halfway down. From the base of the pump, a thin black tube run along the floor over to the kangaroo's backside, where it disappeared between the two furry orange globes of fat. Devon took a deep breath and pressed the plunger all the way down. Another groan bellowed from the 'roo and you swore you saw his already expanded stomach grow ever so slightly bigger.

Devon's face expressed intense concentration for a minute before he sighed. "Okay, that's good for tonight..." he quietly said. The 'roo reached behind him and yanked on the black tube. You had to hold your mouth closed to keep from laughing as the longest fart you've ever heard in your life erupted from Devon's vast ass. As air escaped, the 'roo's stomach deflated and eventually returned to roughly the size it was last night.

The kangaroo smiled in relief and took a few deep breaths. Your heart sank when he gaze turned in your direction. "Are you there, foxy?" he asked. You panicked, paralyzed with fear. "Oh, you can come in!"

You nervously walked into Devon's bedroom, embarrassed that you got caught peaking on him. "I'm sorry! I woke up and heard something and thought you might be in trouble or something!"

"Oh, no worries. Thanks for checking up on me," Devon said reassuringly. "Umm...I guess you're probably wondering what I was doing."

"Yeah. Seriously, you looked huge!"

"Thanks!" Devon gave his deflated belly a pat. "Then I suppose that means I'm doing something right! I was just forcing lots of air into my belly. It's pretty simple. You just stick the hole...in you...then pump away. When you feel ready to burst, hold for as long as you can. When you can't stand it any more, yank out the tube. It's a way of increasing you're stomach capacity. I started doing it a few months ago, and I can eat way more than I used to."

"So now you can eat several cartons of ice cream in one sitting?" you said playfully.

"Well, when you put it that way, it sounds like something you really need," replied Devon with a naughty smirk on his face. "Want to give it a try?"
13223122222.title: Walking in on Devon

choices: Keep going. Maybe a few more pumps
Stop for now. You don't want to go too far
132231222221.content:
"Alright, I'll give it a shot," you said to Devon as you picked up the end of the black tube. "Not too much, okay?"

"Of course," replied Devon. "I don't want to pop a fox anytime soon."

Placing the hose into your rump, you gave the 'roo a thumbs up. He raised up the plunger of the bicycle pump and very slowly pressed. Deep inside you felt air rushing into you, although nothing much had changed visibly. It was only until Devon got to the sixth or seventh pump that you started to see your midsection fill up, a ever-so-slight curve.

"You doing alright, foxy?" Devon asked.

"Yep. I feel perfectly fine!" you replied. The 'roo smiled and went back to pumping at a slow yet methodical pace. With each pump, your stomach bloated out more and more. From what you can see past his bulk, there's nothing that can reasonably fit you. Not surprising, considering how huge this guy is, but still disappointing. 1323111.content:
You take a hearty bite out of your fifth sub-sandwich. Tender strips of beef soak your tongue with flavor while a sharp cheddar flavor chases it down. A sweet, almost sugary, aftertaste lingers long after the first bite of your first sub. Despite your desire to wretch, your stomach growls. A nagging instinct compels you to eat.

"Let me guess, weird aftertaste?" Adam says. He must have seen you grimace.

"Mhm." You nod, at this point you're unwilling to stop eating. Even to talk.

"All the food here has it, no one's really sure why. Just get used to it after awhile." Adam shrugs.

He leans back in his reinforced metal chair. A soft groan escapes his lips. His gut lifts as he stretches -- a few inches of his furry fat peek out beneath his now untucked pastel blue polo. You watch the chair, convinced the metallic creaking was a death knell.

To your surprise, it holds.

Adam scritches his exposed flesh. He even gives it a good pinch before tugging the polo down once more. Albeit, with some struggle to cover the apex of his swollen tum.

"Almost time to go up a size." He says and pats the taut pastel balloon that served as his midsection.

The whole display pulls your thoughts from eating. Fantasies intrude your mind -- what would he look a size bigger? Two more? A heaving middle that scrapes the floor, doughy chest rolls that sag over the sides of his belly, a neck too fat to be recognized as nothing more than a stack of chins.

A deep, hearty laugh shakes you from the fantasy.

"Like what you see?"

"Shit, sorry I'm staring again."

"I'm not offended." He smiles. His cherubic cheeks and lightning blue eyes put you at ease. "And you never answered my question."

Your throat seizes. You know the answer to the question, and you wager he did too. He wanted to hear it. And you wanted to say it. You didn't. Instead you horked down the remainder of your food to keep your mouth busy.

"I'll let you come to it on your own time then." He said. "I think we're off to a good start, you and I."

He leans over the table as best his gut lets him as he prods your distended middle. You groan as a belch forces its way up. You blush and rub your temples as the two of you relax there in the associate break room.

Adam looks to a digital clock hanging from the wall.

"'bout time for me to get off lunch and get back to work. I think I spent more time watching you than actually eating. God I'm going to lose my figure."

"Wait, you're not leaving me here alone are you? What about that Beth person..." You say, trying best not to whimper.

"Amy should be getting off her shift pretty soon. I take it you've got no place to stay."

"You would be correct."

"Alright. Just tell Amy to bring you by my place, and I'll meet you as soon as I get off work."

Adam tucked his shirt back in to the best of his ability and smoothed out any wrinkles.

"Thanks Adam...just one thing before you go."

"Shoot?" He smiled.

"Why help me? I don't have anything to pay you back with, and you don't even know who I am."

"Let's just say I wouldn't even be a fifth of the dog I am today if not for a little help I got when I first moved here. Hang in there. Amy will be here soon. See you after work."

Adam pat your shoulder and shuffled past you. You got a good look at him from behind: his khakis cupped his posterior into perfectly round shapes. It was mesmerizing to watch all of him move at once. Your stray hand pat your belly, wondering how long before you started looking like him. You tried your best to imagine it. What shape you'd actually be, how heavy you would get, all that jazz.

You cursed your lack of imagination -- all you could do is see yourself with Adam's physique. Then again, part of you hoped you won that genetic lottery. He was a lucky guy.

Some time passes while you relax, a few workers shuffle in and out, until...

13231111.content:
A light pat on your shoulder pulls you out of your aimless thoughts. You look up to see Amy smiling at you.

         "Looks like you're doing a little better," she says. You nod. "Anyways, Adam told me he got you a place to stay."

         "Oh, yeah, that's right." You scratch behind one of your ears. Hey, that feels kinda nice. "Um, Adam told me to ask you to take him to his place. Is that alright?"

         There's a subtle shift in her smile, but you can't quite tell what said shift is. "Sure, I can do that. Ready to go?"

         With a mumbled "Yeah," you get up--which isn't so easy thanks to your stuffed gut--and quietly follow Amy out of the employee's lounge. The sight of the store confuses you for a moment, but then you remember it's a clothing store. Being around Adam and that enticing bakery-like smell of his must have made you forget that.

         While you're better off than before, you can't say you feel all that comfortable wearing nothing but an over-sized shirt. It hides your gut pretty well, but based on what Amy told you earlier, that doesn't exactly help.

         You have some questions you really want to ask, but something tells you not to ask them out in public. Paranoia, perhaps. Of course, it's hard not to feel that way in an unfamiliar city with no memories except your name. Honestly, the questions you want to ask most are the ones nobody's likely to have an answer for. As tempting as it is to dwell on all this, you really don't want to with people like that Beth lady around. Not until you know you're safe, at least.

         It doesn't take long for the two of you to reach Amy's car. You have no idea how to classify it aside from big, white, and expensive-looking. Still silent, you get in and buckle up. Everything looks clean up front; either it's a new car, or Amy just really cares about keeping it clean. Regardless, you don't pay it much thought and turn to stare out the window. Wow. Turns out big cars is the norm here. Not surprising, but still quite the sight.

         "Do you think you'll be alright?"

         The question is asked with such a low voice (not to mention the suddenness) that you don't register it at first. Once you do, you look over at Amy, concern in her eyes. The veil of gloom over you lifts slightly.

         "I...think so," you reply slowly. "Adam seems like a guy I can trust." After a pause, you quickly add, "And you too, of course."

         Amy giggles and begins to pull out of the parking spot. "You've already taken a liking to him, I see." You don't answer, instead looking back out the window to hide your blush. It might not be visible beneath your fur, but you'd rather not take the chance. She giggles again. "Yeah, he's a real sweetheart. There's just something about him that makes you want to trust the guy. And then there's that big, soft belly of his..."

         You can feel your blush deepening. You swear it burns.

         "I mean, I've never actually felt it myself, but it sure looks soft. And did you get a good look at his chubby cheeks? It's almost funny how cute how cute they are! You know, considering he's such a big guy."

         Wow, this blush is not gonna go away anytime soon, is it?

         Amy sighs. "But in all seriousness, I can tell he likes you too. I can tell you'll get along well."

         "Thanks," you mumble quietly. You try to focus on looking for any notable landmarks to help you remember the layout. Everything just bleeds together, though. You forget the names of places as soon as you pass them by. Maybe you'd have better luck if you just went for a walk. Then again, you're still not sure if you're willing to risk going out by yourself just yet. Maybe after you've put on some weight.

         Speaking of which...

         "Hey, Amy?"

         "Yeah?"

         You turn to her. She spares a glance back at you. "Does, um..." How should you put this? "Does anyone know...why this place is the way it is? Like, with all the fat stuff, and people randomly showing up naked with no memories of where they came from."

         She doesn't immediately answer. The question hangs in the air for what feels like a good long minute. "No," she finally says. You can't help but notice a slight bitter edge in her tone. "Nobody know anything, really."

         Not an unexpected answer, but still unsatisfying. "Really? Nothing at all?"

         "Nothing at all," she replies. "Every 'newcomer' asks that question. I did, too, when I first got here. Nobody ever gets an answer that isn't 'I don't know.' After that, they do one of two things: they give up and learn to adapt to their new life, or go poking around for answers. And I'll tell you this right now: the second option never works out. Ever."

         You gulp. "Does that..." A chill runs up your spine. "Do you mean they...'mysteriously disappear', or something like that?"

         "Thankfully, no." Amy's tone is a bit lighter now. "There aren't any chains of disappearances tied to some shady corporation or anything. I just meant everyone hits a dead end eventually."

         You let out a breath you didn't know you were holding. "Oh. You made it sound a lot more ominous than that."

         She chuckles wryly. "Sorry. It's just a bit personal."

         "Ah." You decide to leave it at that. She's still mostly a stranger to you, so prying seems a bit rude.

         The rest of the ride carries out in silence. The questions still buzz about in your mind, but knowing you won't get a solid answer sours your drive to ask. So instead, you once more try in vain to make note of any important-looking places. Every now and then, though, your thoughts drift back to Adam.

------

         Adam's house seems big from your perspective, but you get the feeling it's pretty average in this city. It seems well maintained. Not pristine, exactly, but still far from a ratty old mess. The tan paint job looks somewhat recent. And two stories tall, from the look of it. The benefits of a manager's salary, you guess.

         You're waiting by Amy's car as she unlocks the front door for you. She's back in less than a minute.

         "Alright," she says, "you're good to go. Be sure not to eat all his food."

         Oh yeah, you still have that incessant urge to eat. Shrugging, you say, "Somehow, I doubt I could match his appetite."

         Amy grins. "Fair enough. Well, I better get going." She starts for the driver's seat, then stops. "Oh, and be good to Adam. No taking advantage of his hospitality, or you and I are going to have a talk."

         "I'll, uh, keep that in mind. Thanks, Amy."

         She nods, and the two of you wave goodbye. She's already long gone by the time you're through the door. After locking it, you sigh.

         "Might as well get comfy," you mutter.
